title: GH-180: Missing ReduceProd.
body:
I am adding an implementation for ReduceProd (equivalent to TF's [reduce_prod](https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.12/api_docs/python/math_ops/reduction#reduce_prod)).

I am also surreptitiously including a little change to make TFShape automatically convertible to TFTensor whenever possible (in the same way that [arrays are already convertible to TFTensor](https://github.com/migueldeicaza/TensorFlowSharp/blob/master/TensorFlowSharp/Tensor.cs#L635)).

Accepting this PR should solve #180.

title: Missing ReduceProd
body:
TFS has ReduceSum, ReduceMean, but still no ReduceProd.

I will send a PR with a ReduceProd implementation in the next minutes.

title: Formatting & style
body:
Hi @migueldeicaza,

While I am aware of the project instance against unilateral uneccessary code refactorings (e.g. #39) and I mostly agree with them, I have to say that some files would indeed benefit from at least some code style normalizations to at least enforce consistency. Right now, in the same file, it is possible to find multiple bracket styles being used (e.g. [K&R](https://github.com/migueldeicaza/TensorFlowSharp/blob/master/TensorFlowSharp/Tensorflow.cs#L54) and [Allman's](https://github.com/migueldeicaza/TensorFlowSharp/blob/master/TensorFlowSharp/Tensorflow.cs#L125)), indentation using both [spaces and tabs](https://github.com/migueldeicaza/TensorFlowSharp/blob/master/TensorFlowSharp/Tensorflow.cs#L1033-L1039), and different [rules](https://github.com/migueldeicaza/TensorFlowSharp/blob/master/TensorFlowSharp/Tensorflow.cs#L1595) [regarding](https://github.com/migueldeicaza/TensorFlowSharp/blob/master/TensorFlowSharp/Tensorflow.cs#L2379) spaces.

I know this is minimal, but if you allow me I could at least enforce the .editorconfig style I had created a while ago to solve those inconsistencies - then at least, everyone else using VS2017 would have been able to enforce the same formatting style when hitting Ctrl+E,D (or Ctrl+K, D).

title: GH-177: Transpose overload without explicit perm parameter
body: Solves #177

title: Transpose overload without explicit perm parameter
GH-120: Adding support for tf.Cond
body:
This PR adds support for [tf.cond](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/cond) in TensorFlowSharp. 

In order for tf.cond to work, I had to add support for the [tf.Graph.control_dependencies(control_inputs)](https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.12/api_docs/python/framework/core_graph_data_structures) method, which I have re-named ```WithDependencies``` to follow the same style used with ```WithScope```. For this I have introduced a new class, ```TFDependency```, which is analogous to ```TFScope``` but serves to controls the ```TFGraph.CurrentDependencies``` property instead of ```CurrentNameScope```.

I took the liberty to fix a few documentation warnings along the way in this PR. 

Accepting this PR closes #120

title: Native lib from tensorflow nightly build and TensorFlowSharp nuget package provide different APIs
body:
I just noticed that 'libtensorflow.dylib' from the TesorFlowSharp nuget package and from tensorflow nightly build artifacts (for instance, [from here](http://ci.tensorflow.org/view/Nightly/job/nightly-libtensorflow/TYPE=mac-slave/82/artifact/lib_package/libtensorflow-cpu-darwin-x86_64.tar.gz ) or [from here](https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/libtensorflow/libtensorflow-cpu-darwin-x86_64-1.3.0.tar.gz) ) provide different APIs.

The problem is that we use the 'libtensorflow.dylib' from nightly build in CI on Travis and it's missing bitwise operations like BitwiseAnd, BitwiseOr and others, but they all exist in the library shipping in TensorFlowSharp nuget.

Where do we get the native libraries for the nuget package and how can we download and use them on the Travis CI?

title: Linear Regression model built from python, running in C#.
body:
I'm struggling with getting simple models built in Python "productionized" into C#.
This is what I see as a first class use case for this library, but I am not seeing a good example for it.

Take a model built, trained, and saved in python.
Save off the *.pb file (From what i can gather, that is all i need)
In C#:
Create Graph, a Session, Input Variables, Input Values, and Outputs to run the model.
Run the model, then interrogate the output.

The most challenging part for me is constructing the InputVariables, InputValues, and Output. The construction patterns, and instance usages for those objects are befuddling me to say the least.

I assume I am not seeing a pattern in the examples, or that I am fighting the naming conventions, or... I don't know what I am missing... And I can't be the only person struggling with this.

The python code is attached. It's a simple linear regression model I ripped off from a stanford class and made more portable.

Here are the samples i am trying to create. Happy to donate them to the cause when they are complete.
[FireTheftLinearRegression.py.txt](https://github.com/migueldeicaza/TensorFlowSharp/files/1307768/FireTheftLinearRegression.py.txt)

C# portion here:
https://gist.github.com/sqlBender/32dcb9f9ac213620db0d09788cf55176

body:
https://github.com/migueldeicaza/TensorFlowSharp/blob/30314fdbcf63d79cc147f03a9bb96bae261d0782/SampleTest/SampleTest.cs#L295

Attempting to follow the [basic MNIST tuts from Tensorflow's website](https://www.tensorflow.org/get_started/mnist/beginners). TFGraph Mul operation won't accept TFGraph Variables, found this line in yall's tests and it results in similar issue.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20599319/29885216-0f6628bc-8d84-11e7-97f0-a19f03af93c7.png)
Continuing results in this exception:
{"Inconsistent values for attr 'T' DT_FLOAT vs. DT_RESOURCE while building NodeDef 'Mul0' using Op<name=Mul; signature=x:T, y:T -> z:T; attr=T:type,allowed=[DT_HALF, DT_FLOAT, DT_DOUBLE, DT_UINT8, DT_INT8, DT_UINT16, DT_INT16, DT_INT32, DT_INT64, DT_COMPLEX64, DT_COMPLEX128]; is_commutative=true>"}

Any info on how to approach this? TFGraph Variables are Resource types and apparently can't be Mul'd with Floats, so I'm at a loss as to how this test is supposed to work or how I can go through the tuts on Tensorflow's site.

Forgive my formatting and any ambiguity, I'm new to GitHub and this is out of my realm.

title: Answer: How to use TanhGrad (with test sample)
How to specify the TFOutput type?
body:
I'm not sure if this is the correct location to pose this question.
But I haven't found answers anywhere.

This code:

```csharp
using (var graph = new TFGraph())
{
    graph.Import(File.ReadAllBytes("graph.pb"));  // Frozen Graph
    var session = new TFSession(graph);
    var input = new TFTensor(new float[60 * 60]); // Let's pretend this is 60 by 60 image.

    var w = session.Run(new[] {graph["input_node/X"][0]}, new[] { input }, new[] { graph["output_node/Y"][0] });
}
```

throws this exception:

```csharp
Unhandled Exception: TensorFlow.TFException: You must feed a value for placeholder tensor 'output_node/Y' with dtype float
         [[Node: output_node/Y = Placeholder[dtype=DT_FLOAT, shape=[], _device="/job:localhost/replica:0/task:0/cpu:0"]()]]
   at TensorFlow.TFStatus.CheckMaybeRaise(TFStatus incomingStatus, Boolean last)
   at TensorFlow.TFSession.Run(TFOutput[] inputs, TFTensor[] inputValues, TFOutput[] outputs, TFOperation[] targetOpers, TFBuffer runMetadata, TFBuffer runOptions, TFStatus status)
```

It's telling me my output needs to be of type `float` which internally, (I believe), maps to: `DT_FLOAT`.
How do I do that?

If I look at my pbtext file:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9978724/29797476-2832dc36-8c4f-11e7-8c7b-6ea6f06172e9.png)

The type is already `DT_FLOAT`. What am I missing.
Kind Regards

title: Adding support for jagged arrays as inputs to TFTensor
body:
Adding a possible solution for #33. I've used the current implementations from the Accord.NET Framework as a base without many modifications. As such, it can be the case that those implementations could have been more optimized for the particular use case here, namely, to simply convert from Jagged to Multidimensional arrays such that they could be given as inputs to TFTensor.

Being the sole author and writer of those relevant lines, I license them under the MIT license as the rest of the TensorFlowSharp project.

title: Add auto versioning
body:
This adds auto-versioning based on @AArnott's [Nerdbank.Gitversioning](https://github.com/AArnott/Nerdbank.GitVersioning).

Every time you build, it'll bump the `{height}` parameter as in the `version.json` file. Use whatever format you want in there.

For non-release branches, it'll add the git hash in the version to disambiguate. For release branches (as defined in the `version.json`, it won't.

To do a release, remove the pre-release tag from the `version.json`, check it in and build. Then after your release, add the pre-release version back in. The purpose of this is to have complete build reproducibility. 

This will set the `Assembly*` versions and also the NuGet package version when you pack it.

System.BadImageFormatException
body:
Simple use case failed with a vanilla install and configuration.

1. Fresh install of Python on Windows x64
2. Fresh install of tensorflow using pip (no GPU support)
3. Fresh install of Visual Studio 2017 Enterprise
4. Create new command-line project
5. In project properties, target .NET Framework 4.6.1
6. Under VS Tools menu, select nuget console and run "Install-Package TensorFlowSharp"
7. In project, add reference to packages\TensorFlowSharp.1.2.2\lib\net461\TensorFlowSharp.dll
8. In Program.cs, "using TensorFlow;" and in Main "var session = new TFSession()"

Hit run. Program immediately crashed with exception...

`System.BadImageFormatException: 'Could not load file or assembly 'TensorFlowSharp, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null' or one of its dependencies. An attempt was made to load a program with an incorrect format.'
`

title: TFGraph.Dropout?
body:
Hi there,

I've noticed that the ```TFGraph``` class includes many operations from the tf.nn python modules, such as ELU, [Relu](https://migueldeicaza.github.io/TensorFlowSharp/api/TensorFlow/TensorFlow.TFGraph.html#TensorFlow_TFGraph_Relu_TensorFlow_TFOutput_System_String_), and TanH.

However, I couldn't help but notice that the [tf.nn.dropout](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/nn/dropout) operation is not present there (yet?).

Being that this is quite a ubiquitous operation in most modern deep learning applications, I guess it is available somewhere else, but I couldn't find yet where its precise location is right now. If that is the case, sorry for the stupid question, but may I ask where it could be found?

Regards,
Cesar

FYI: Most of the Simple Test is derived from Basic Models
![brave_2017-05-30_23-36-17](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8244633/26606163/2841d8d0-4591-11e7-9483-8c66943030c8.png)

**Questions**:  
[1] It has been claimed that Most of the C Api has been ported and exposed through Tensorflowsharp
=> What is the best way to move on to the 3_Nueral Network Models?  
=> Are we ready to just read through what have been ported to Basic Models and start porting the Neural Network python codes to TensorflowSharp?

=> I have download the **latest Widows DLL with TF_NEWWHILE exposed**. Running it still results in TF_WHILEFINISH **error**.

[2] Are we ready to do LOTs of Porting? What else need to be done? I do not have the overview. We get recommendations. How should we best proceed. Any suggestion/feedback? Anyone has proceed to deploy tensorflowSharp in routine and porting python code?

title: [Enhancement] Enable Unity integration by targeting .NET 3.5

Background: I'm working on multi-agent simulations in 3D. Unity is a good platform because it is C#, targets Mac/Windows/Android/iOS and has strong 3D. Unfortunately Unity is limited to (roughly) .NET 3.5 vs TensorFlowSharp target 4.6.1.

This may sound crazy :) but is it feasible to change TensorFlowSharp to target .NET 3.5?

The only issue I'm aware off offhand is C# 7.0 tuples. Apparently there are solutions targeting .NET 3.5 https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7469700/is-there-something-like-tuple-in-net-3-5 but I don't know if these are any good.

I have done Unity plugins before so happy to take on that part.

Hey Miguel, please check if this fix is looks right. If this is correct I expect there are other places where the ref [] pattern needs to be fixed (I just did the one causing SampleTest to fail). btw I also wondered if these pointers should be handled as unsafe but the post below says no...

UPDATE  I just noticed that the unsafe declaration is in the DllImport (static extern unsafe void TF_GraphGetTensorShape...) so yeah, I think this is the correct fix. title: Possibly unnecessary or buggy branching when fetching jagged arrays?
body:
Specifically here: https://github.com/migueldeicaza/TensorFlowSharp/blob/1e267e83ad1e19e6a2f333f5363de8186c2da782/TensorFlowSharp/Tensor.cs#L795-L814

As far as I can tell, the only difference between these two branches is the casting of top (a long) to int and its subsequent assignment to itop. However, these variables are only used in a for loop with an int counter.

This leaves me with two questions:

1) Is this branching necessary? Seems like we could just always use int for both "top" and the loop counter. I don't think there's support for arrays with more than Int32.MaxValue dimension in .Net. That said, throwing a "too long array" exception might also be acceptable, since this simply ignoring a chunk of the data also seems bad. I don't know tensorflow well enough to comment on the appropriate API behavior here.

2) Is this code currently buggy? If top is, in fact, greater than the max value of an int32, won't "l" (the integer counter for the for loop in that branch) wrap and never reach it?

title: TFTensor constructors
body: I probably should remove all the low-level constructors, and make them some sort of properly named factory method, and keep the constructors for the most common operations.

title: Add Run(Expression)
body:
In Python, this code is possible:

```
session.run(a+b)
```

This both produces the Add operation with the two parameters, but also the result is automatically fetched.

Generally, this requires a "context" to properly work, as in the more common scenario, you would not only be doing Add operations, but likely invoking other methods, and those methods currently live in the TFGraph class.

So either we do what the Python bindings do which is to have a global variable for a default context, and surface an API that operates on this global context or we end up with an API that is not as pretty looking as it could be.

title: Upgrade samples to use Runner() API in TFSession, instead of the ugly Run()
Handle "ref" parameters
body:
There are some 112 operations in TensorFlow that are not surfaced as high-level operations because the input or output parameters have the is_ref property set to true, for example:

BarrierInsertMany 

Where the input_arg "handle" is a string/ref.  See the file `tensorflow/core/ops/ops.pbtxt` for a textual dump of the API.

It is not clear what to do with these data types on the strong binding, neither Go or Java deal with them.

title: Operation generation - Shape instead of long []
body: Since version 6b4dd84acffe16579e4dd5c20109c91378b2b2de, the Go bindings introduced a new "Shape" API, replacing the long[] API to represent shapes.   Need to update generator with it.

6b4dd84acffe16579e4dd5c20109c91378b2b2de

title: Add MonoDoc APIs
body:

Once that happens, I will do a one-time import into Monodoc and drop the API docs from the source (except operations, which we can reimport easily as I do not care about overwriting).

title: Add support to TFGraph Scope functionality to create unique names
body: This should allow operations to be automatically named, as well as dealing with namespace clashes.

title: An unhandled exception of type 'System.BadImageFormatException' occurred in TensorFlowSharp.dll
Windows

This is a great wrapper for C# and has worked well in my Ubuntu 16.04 partition when using the tensorflow shared object.

However, I was wondering if you know if there is any way to use Bazel to compile a libtensorflow.dll so that this could work with Windows too? I saw that you said to change the name of the shared object generated to '.dll', however this seems to produce a 'BadImageFormatException' in VS2015 Windows.

title: upgraded .NET to v4.6.1 and small syntax fix for VS2015
TFSession.Run (runOptions) should be the last parameter, and be made optional.
Perhaps I should "namespace" the various operations in TFGraph
body: Python has a nice hierarchy for operations, for example `tf.image.decode_png`, while we have `DecodePng` along another few hundred methods.

title: TFTensor.GetValue ()
body: Add an overload that returns not a multi-dimensional array, but jagged arrays, as they are easier to manipulate.

title: upgraded .NET to v4.5.1
body:
support GetFunctionPointerForDelegate<Action<T1,T2>>

*small syntax fixes VS2015

title: Introduce IRefCount
body: The complex graphs and nodes are a good chance to experiment with an IRefCount on TFGraph.

title: Defensive TFOutput
body: Handle a few structs that can be invalid, like TFOutput to prevent it from calling unmanaged code with broken data and crash.

title: Const operation should provide convenience conversion into a Tensor.
body:
This is a common op:
```
graph.Const (TFTensor.Constant (value));
```

Or perhaps we should offer implicit conversions from various data types into TFTensors?

title: TFBuffer - should it have a GCHandle to itself and release upon FreeFunc?
TFGraph.ImportGraphDef
body: Currently we take a TFImportGraphDefOptions which has only one possible option, a string prefix, perhaps we should just take that string prefix for now.

title: TFTensor constructor
body:
They currently take single-dimension array of values, with a dims[] array, the dims [] array should probably be hardcoded, and we can get rid of this extra nuisance.

That is, I believe this:

```
		public TFTensor (long [] dims, float [] data) : base (SetupTensor (TFDataType.Float, dims, data, size: 4)) { }
```

Should become:

```
		public TFTensor (float [] data) : base (SetupTensor (TFDataType.Float, dims, data, size: 4)) { }
```

And we should just copute the `long [] dims` inside SetupTensor.

title: Generated operation return types
body:
Currently the generated operation return types have signatures that return the outputs as ref parameters, like this:

```
ref TFOutput one, ref TFOutput two,...
```

Or if there is a single output, instead of a TFOperation, we return a TFOutput.

Perhaps for consistency, we should have two sets of overloads, one that always return the TFOperation, with all ref parameters, and one that returns a TFOutput or a tuple of those (would need C# 7 to be nice enough)

title: The high-level construction operations can enforce list requirements
body: There are a few constraints like length (x) > 4 that could be enforced in the high-level generated APIs.

title: Operation generation - need to support optional arguments
body: Along with their documentation.

title: Scope is currently an empty class and unused
body: Only used as a parameter to create the operations, review the Go code to determine if it is worth keeping around or not.

title: High-level definition parameters
body:
Should the high-level definition parameters be C#-ified?

Currently they have names like "orig_input", should I rename them "origInput"?

title: Should TFSession expose a higher-level API?
body:
The current binding exposes a couple of `Run` methods with far from ideal APIs, as inputs and input values are specified separately and are far from pleasant.

C
=

The `CSession` type in the C API exercise class instead opts for SetInputs, SetOuputs methods to remove the ugliness.   Should this higher level construct be part of the default C# API?

Given that TFSession is not resurfaced from unmanaged pointers, there are no drawbacks to keeping managed state to assist.

Java
====

Similarly, the Java API exposes a "Runner()" method that surfaces a wrapper class that keeps track of the various inputs, outputs and targets.   Instead of calling session.Run, you must call session.Runner() to get the runner object, then configure the properites, and then invoke Run() on the result.

Go
==
Go has a more limited API that does not surface the TFBuffer options, and additionally takes a dictionary for the outputs/outvalues

title: Figure out an idiom for TFOperation lifetime
body:
The object is only valid as long as the TFGraph object exists, when the TFGraph goes away, the TFOperation goes away as well.   So we need a way to either track all TFOperations in a TFGraph [1] or we need TFOperations to keep a pointer to the TFGraph and check if the obejct is still valid on each call, and if not zero out their handle/flag the object as useless.

[1] This is easy, provided that we never need to re-surface a TFGraph back into managed code from a native pointer, we just keep a list of all the objects created.

title: Fix discrepancy between TF_Operation and TF_OperationDescription
body:
The latter evolves into the former when you call "FinishOperation()", and this is not currently taken into account.

What needs to happen when you call FinishOperation is that we should transfer the handle ownership (investigate if we need to delete the original handle or not).

title: Multiple servers to the same client? Peer-to-peer planned in future?
body:
Hi Sébastien,

because everything works very well, I would like to reach the next step in my requirements to connect multiple databases with identical schemes.

Hopefully I learned and understand more about the concept behind Dotmim.Sync and I read all relevant issue posts about this question.

I just want to confirm my conclusions:

* For now it is not possible to build a sync structure with multiple servers to the same client, even if the clients never pushes data?

Because ideal for me would be multiple server dbs each having a seperate import db, but some data should be pushed to the same online export db.

* To solve that, it would need one big server which controls all pulls and pushes, because you implemented here a client-server only solution, right?

This would be not easy to handle for me, because it would result easy in a 50+ GB size and I would have to change a lot of processes.

Further I had a 2 day research about the possilities for a peer-to-peer solution, which brought me to MS Sync Framework 2.1, which seems not to be developed any further. So it seems to be not a good choice anymore.

But I wonder why it's not developed any further and why my research for alternatives are surprisingly sparse, even in the commercial sector.

Do you have plans for the future to go in a peer-to-peer direction?

How big you estimate would be the efforts to implement in Dotmim.Sync to a peer-to-peer functionalty?
I would give it both thumbs up and do my best to support that.

Hmm, I see now my questions might be better asked under discussions, sorry for that mistake.

Best Florian

title: The stream does not support writing
body:
This exception has popped up beginning a sync to a new device. `The stream does not support writing`.

The stack trace
```
   at Dotmim.Sync.Web.Client.HttpRequestHandler.<HandleSyncError>d__15.MoveNext()
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at Dotmim.Sync.Web.Client.HttpRequestHandler.<SendAsync>d__14.MoveNext()
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at Dotmim.Sync.SyncPolicy.<InternalExecuteAsync>d__17`1.MoveNext()
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at Dotmim.Sync.Web.Client.HttpRequestHandler.<ProcessRequestAsync>d__12.MoveNext()
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at Dotmim.Sync.Web.Client.WebClientOrchestrator.<EnsureSchemaAsync>d__35.MoveNext()
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at Dotmim.Sync.SyncAgent.<>c__DisplayClass53_0.<<SynchronizeAsync>b__0>d.MoveNext()
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at Dotmim.Sync.SyncAgent.<SynchronizeAsync>d__53.MoveNext()
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter`1.GetResult()
   at Wbl.Services.DataService.<SyncNowAsync>d__28.MoveNext() in C:\Repos\FREE\Wbl\Services\DataService.cs:line 128
```

DMS creates the local SQLite database, usually as a copy of the SQL Server database, over http. In this case the local SQLite database is not completed by DMS. It has only a single table `scope_info` showing the value `DefaultScope`, then it throws this exception.

We have `DMS 0.8.0` on the client and the web server. Rebooting the client PC didn't help. We've also cleaned up and restarted the web server in case there were resource issues there. This issue has since been replicated on another machine trying to do a new install.

Where do we look next?

title: How to get the progress in a WinForms app?
body:
Hi Sébastien,

What a great piece of software, I have been looking for since month. Thank you a lot!
It solved all my tasks in days, with previous solutions I struggled for months with problems.

Some newbie questions are left and it would be very kind if you confirm my learnings:

* The best way to insert FK referenced tables at once is with `SyncOptions DisableConstaints = true` right?
* To filter rows in a range of value the approach is  `.AddCustomWhere` ?

* **How to get the progress in a WinForms app**?
Because I work with GUI and EF Core async/await is no option for me in my project, but with:

```
SyncResult syncResult = Task<SyncResult>.Run(() => 
    agent.SynchronizeAsync(syncType) // ,progress
    ).Result; 
```

everything works perfect, clean and stable, but when I try to get the progress:

```
// Using the IProgress<T> pattern to handle progression during the synchronization
var progress = new SynchronousProgress<ProgressArgs>(s => 
	Console.WriteLine($"{s.PogressPercentageString}:\t{s.Source}:\t{s.Message}")
);
```
the syncResult process runs forever and never calls back, neither an console output is visible. Which is not a huge problem because it's so amazing fast.

Would you recommend some improvements in my case?

Besides: There is a small typo in `ProgressArgs.PogressPercentageString` should be `ProgressArgs.ProgressPercentageString`.

Best regards
Florian

title: Can type check be ignored for excluded columns?
body:
Hi, 

First of all I have to say that I'm quite new to C# .Net programming so I might be missing obvious solutions, but...
Is there a way to skip type checking columns in the schema that are not included in the sync?

What I'm trying to do:
`DatabaseA ----downloadonly----> DatabaseB`

`DatabaseA` is a vendor database that I cannot modify, `DatabaseB` is a database that I use in my application.
DatabaseA has a table (Table1) with a lot of columns, but two of which are `text` columns. But let's say there are 4 columns: 
```sql
Id as int, 
Name as nvarchar,
Emailaddress as nvarchar, 
Info as text
```
I only need the first 3 columns.
So this is my code.

```c#
...
var serverProvider = new SqlSyncProvider(Configuration.GetConnectionString("DatabaseA"));
var clientProvider = new SqlSyncProvider(Configuration.GetConnectionString("DatabaseB"));

var setup = new SyncSetup(new string[] { "Table1" });
setup.Tables["Table1"].Columns.AddRange(new string[] { "Id", "Name", "Emailaddress" });
setup.Tables["Table1"].SyncDirection = SyncDirection.DownloadOnly;

var agent = new SyncAgent(clientProvider, serverProvider, setup);

progress = new SynchronousProgress<ProgressArgs>(args =>
    Log.Information($"{args.PogressPercentageString}:\t{args.Source}:\t{args.Message}"));

var result = new SyncResult();

do {
   result = await agent.SynchronizeAsync(progress);
} while (Console.ReadKey().Key != ConsoleKey.Escape);
...
```

My assumption was that all other columns would be ignored, but this fails:
```
[11:11:08 INF] 0,00%:   b33de51e-a55e-4f00-957e-288424ab22c9:   Session Begins.
Unhandled exception. Dotmim.Sync.SyncException: this type name text is not supported
 ---> System.Exception: this type name text is not supported
   at Dotmim.Sync.SqlServer.Manager.SqlDbMetadata.ValidateOwnerDbType(String typeName, Boolean isUnsigned, Boolean isUnicode, Int64 maxLength)
   at Dotmim.Sync.SqlServer.Builders.SqlBuilderTable.GetColumnsAsync(DbConnection connection, DbTransaction transaction)
   at Dotmim.Sync.BaseOrchestrator.InternalGetTableSchemaAsync(SyncContext context, SyncSetup setup, SetupTable setupTable, DbConnection connection, DbTransaction transaction, CancellationToken cancellationToken, IProgress`1 progress)
   at Dotmim.Sync.BaseOrchestrator.InternalGetSchemaAsync(SyncContext context, SyncSetup setup, DbConnection connection, DbTransaction transaction, CancellationToken cancellationToken, IProgress`1 progress)
   at Dotmim.Sync.BaseOrchestrator.<>c__DisplayClass83_0.<<GetSchemaAsync>b__0>d.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location ---
   at Dotmim.Sync.BaseOrchestrator.RunInTransactionAsync[T](SyncStage stage, Func`4 actionTask, DbConnection connection, DbTransaction transaction, CancellationToken cancellationToken)
   --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
```

Is there a way, maybe with an interceptor, to fully exclude that "info" column?

title: Sync to new device is slow
body:
Testing with a ~500mb SQLite database, legacy data is upgraded to SQLite. The SQLite db is synced to SQL Server using DMS over https.

At the end of the initial sync a snapshot is created on the server.

We find the initial sync of server data back to another device is quite slow. DMS takes around 1 hour 15mins to sync that server data to a new SQLite database.

The app we have in production, not using DMS, takes 15-20mins to sync to a new device with the same test data.

We test on a very fast internet connection. Most of our customers have slower, less reliable internet.

[Download snapshot is not resilient to connection interruption #470](https://github.com/Mimetis/Dotmim.Sync/issues/470) introduced retry logic. That is most appreciated. But if we do go live with DMS, our customers will notice how much slower it is to add our app to a new device.

The issue does not seem to be related to indexes as the snapshot is already created. The server we use for testing now appears to have sufficient resources. We use batch size=2000 as I assume a smaller batch size is more resilient.

Is there anything else we can do, or DMS can do to reduce the time DMS takes to sync to a new device?

title: MERGE conflict in DMS 7.0
body:
The following exception is thrown by `SyncResult syncResult = await syncAgent.SynchronizeAsync();`

`The MERGE statement conflicted with the FOREIGN KEY SAME TABLE constraint "FK_Jobs_OrderDetails". The conflict occurred in database "AU13237", table "dbo.Jobs", column 'JobId'. The statement has been terminated.`

All jobs must appear on an order detail. Not all order details include a job.

On SQL Server the job on the order details table is defined `[JobId] [uniqueidentifier] NULL`
Order detail on the jobs table is defined `[Jobs].[OrderDetailId] [uniqueidentifier] NOT NULL`

Foreign keys
```
ALTER TABLE [dbo].[Jobs]  WITH CHECK ADD  CONSTRAINT [FK_Jobs_OrderDetails] FOREIGN KEY([OrderDetailId])
REFERENCES [dbo].[Jobs] ([JobId])

ALTER TABLE [dbo].[OrderDetails]  WITH CHECK ADD  CONSTRAINT [FK_OrderDetails_Jobs] FOREIGN KEY([JobId])
REFERENCES [dbo].[Jobs] ([JobId])
```

This error does not occur in `DMS 6.2`. We've rolled back.

This library is very useful and I'm a beginner.

I have a working windows desktop application using sqlite and there's some rows in `Orders` table.

Sqlite table:

```sql
CREATE TABLE "Orders" (
	"OrderId"	TEXT NOT NULL,
	"DateTime"	TEXT NOT NULL,
	"CustomerName"	TEXT,
	"CustomerTelephone"	TEXT,
	"SalesmanName"	TEXT,
	"Comments"	TEXT,
	"TotalWeight"	REAL,
	"TotalMoney"	REAL,
	"IsSynced"	INTEGER NOT NULL,
	PRIMARY KEY("OrderId")
);
```

I manually created the same table in remote mysql(changing some data types)

```mysql
CREATE TABLE Orders (
	OrderId	VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
	`DateTime`	DATETIME NOT NULL,
	CustomerName	VARCHAR(20),
	CustomerTelephone	VARCHAR(20),
	SalesmanName	VARCHAR(20),
	Comments	VARCHAR(50),
	TotalWeight	DECIMAL(7, 3),

);
```

Now I add the sync code after inserting rows into sqlite:

```csharp

            var clientProvider = new SqliteSyncProvider(Constants.SqliteConnectionString);

```

The result:

IF (sync_row_count = 0) THEN

title: Xamarin.Forms for iOS JSON issues with Utf8Json
body:
While running a Xamarin.Forms project with Dotmim.Sync 0.6.1+ we are seeing the following exception from Dotmim.Sync.Serialization.Utf8JsonConverter:

```System.TypeInitializationException: The type initializer for 'Utf8Json.Resolvers.StandardResolver' threw an exception.
  System.TypeInitializationException: The type initializer for 'Utf8Json.Resolvers.Internal.DefaultStandardResolver' threw an exception.
    System.TypeInitializationException: The type initializer for 'InnerResolver' threw an exception.
      System.TypeInitializationException: The type initializer for 'Utf8Json.Resolvers.DynamicObjectResolver' threw an exception.
        System.TypeInitializationException: The type initializer for 'Utf8Json.Resolvers.Internal.DynamicObjectResolverAllowPrivateFalseExcludeNullFalseNameMutateOriginal' threw an exception.
          System.PlatformNotSupportedException: Operation is not supported on this platform.
```


According to the author of Utf8Json, use on iOS requires precode generation: https://github.com/neuecc/Utf8Json/issues/74#issuecomment-384912715

While investigating, I was able to switch from Utf8JsonConverter to the previous JsonConverter in BatchPartInfo.cs without running into that problem. Would it be possible to have JSON library selection be a global setting that we could adjust per platform?

User make a insert into Primary, data is written into DB in DateTimeUTC

title: SqlCipher doesn't work on Android
body:
I am facing an issue similar to #402. What worked in that scenario doesn't work for me unfortunately.

I am working with a `Xamarin.Forms` application (Android and iOS). I installed `Dotmim.Sync.Sqlite` and `Dotmim.Sync.Web.Client` in my shared project and am using `sqlite-net-base` for ORM and `SQLitePCLRaw.bundle_e_sqlcipher` following his suggestions [here](https://github.com/ericsink/SQLitePCL.raw/wiki/How-to-use-SQLCipher-with-SQLite-net).

So I setup my project and tried to sync my database which works just fine for iOS but doesn't work when running the same on Android project. The error that I get is:
`Exception:You specified a password in the connection string, but the native SQLite library 'e_sqlite3' doesn't support encryption.`

## What didn't work
I tried to work with suggestions in #402 but that doesn't work for me and results in the same error
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17280428/109233267-2df52000-778f-11eb-8fea-a25a87e49ee6.png)

## What does work?
If I download a copy of `Dotmim.Sync` github repo, change the nuget packages of the project `Dotmim.Sync.Sqlite` by applying the commands suggested by brycelam:
```
dotnet remove package Microsoft.Data.Sqlite
dotnet add package Microsoft.Data.Sqlite.Core
dotnet add package SQLitePCLRaw.bundle_e_sqlcipher
```
And then reference this version of `Dotmim.Sync.Sqlite`, it works on both iOS and Android!!

title: Azure, 230 second limit
body:
As you might know Azure has a 230 second limit for webrequest, which can't be changed.

Since I will be running this code on an Azure server I need to make sure that all requests are handled within that 230 second period, eventhough this might make the whole process longer. Because of this I have a couple of question to know if it could aid in making sure the 230 limit is not hit.

Is there anything we can do on the server database that speeds things up? 
Does the batch size on the server matter in speeding up the request time, or does it only matter for the time needed for the whole process?
Same question for the client.

I was able to time out the server in my tests by sending a lot of client changes, which is a situation that could realistically happen when a user is offline for some period (and can't sync as a result). Does the client batch size matter for this situation?

I have been testing on a test server (duh :)) which is not the most powerful server in the world, far from it :) What would benefit the sync framework more: more power to the sql database, or more power for the webserver itself? As far as I understand the framework I think that the webserver itself is the bottleneck, correct? So upscaling the cpu it has available would speed up the sync.

Some tables will rarely change and I am supplying the clients with the current values. This means that initially these tables don't really need to sync. Is there any way to mark a record as the same as the server? 
I have noticed that when I extended my tests to contain those tables as well, the time it needed for that initial sync went up although it doesn't really need to sync anything. I figured that checking those table was the extra time needed (5 tables, +- 250 records combined)

I will be bringing the code up & running in a pool of around 8000 possible clients (it is opt-in) and am trying to keep the possibility of failure as low as possible :)

Thanks for the awesome work!

title: Enhancement - use httpresponse to stream baches into a file directly and not keep it in memory

title: Download snapshot is not resilient to connection interruption
body:
I was fortunate to be able to test DMS on a flakey connection. When downloading a 170mb snapshot, there were occasional http exceptions. After each exception DMS stated downloading the snapshot again. It downloaded over 2gb of snapshot before I killed the process.

Our customers are often not as fortunate as us in the quality of their internet connections. We are considering migrating one of our apps from Realm to DMS. DMS would suit this app better than Realm on a reliable connection, but Realm is more resilient to unreliable connections. Where a connection is lost during a large sync, Realm will pickup where it left off.

I experimented with batch sizes from 500 to 10,000, but was unable to get a device to initialise a SQLite database from a SQL Server (over http) using a snapshot, over a flakey connection.

The flakey connection was adequate for web browsing and email. There, just not consistent.

Can DMS be made more resilient to intermittent internet when downloading a snapshot?

title: SQLITE: User UPSERT instead of INSERT OR REPLACE to avoid data loss
body:
Currently, the UPSERT sql statement on SQLite looks like this 


```sql
INSERT OR REPLACE INTO [ProductCategory]
([ProductID], [Name])
SELECT [c].[ProductID], [c].[Name] FROM (SELECT @ProductID as [ProductID], @Name as [Name) as [c]
LEFT JOIN [Product_tracking] AS [side] ON [side].[ProductID] = @ProductID
LEFT JOIN [Product] AS [base] ON [c].[ProductID] = [base].[ProductID]
WHERE ([base].[ProductID] = @ProductID AND ([side].[timestamp] < @sync_min_timestamp OR [side].[update_scope_id] = @sync_scope_id)) 
OR ([base].[ProductID] IS NULL  AND ([side].[timestamp] < @sync_min_timestamp OR [side].[timestamp] IS NULL)) 
OR @sync_force_write = 1;

```

Well, I am not so happy with INSERT OR REPLACE in SQLite, as this means, that we cannot have any additional rows in the sqlite database that are not synchronized.

Isn't there an INSERT OR UPDATE variant as well?

It could, for example, be necessary, to have an additonal column in the client database, that does not exist on the server, nor is it synchronized.
When you now run INSERT OR REPLACE and the row already exists localls, REPLACE would just overwrite the existing row like DELETE AND INSERT)

Thus, our local column would be cleared!


There is a new syntax in Sqlite allowing an UPSERT mode, using a macro `INSERT INTO T VALUES() ON CONFLICT() DO UPDATE` : https://www.sqlite.org/lang_UPSERT.html

To be honest, I think I've already tried this technic, but in my memories, I had some problem with the different tables joins and where clauses.
But once again, it's a bit old, and I just don't remember exactly what happened...
Not sure it can be applied in our scenario, but we can try (again? ) I guess :)

_Originally posted by @Mimetis in https://github.com/Mimetis/Dotmim.Sync/discussions/453#discussioncomment-380578_

title: #458 - sqliteprovider only sends local changes

title: Sending Changes, from Sqlite. Mitigation on `update_scope_id`
body:
## 3. Sending Changes, from Sqlite. Mitigation on `update_scope_id`

I get your point on the `[side].[update_scope_id] <> @sync_scope_id` 
Basically this condition is mostly used on the server side.
If I want to rephrase it, It basically says to the server (from a client perspective) : 

**Please don't send me back the changes I just sent to you, because we know that they are already in sync, since ... I just sent these changes to you server, and you applied them correctly :)**

Indeed, from a client perspective, this condition is never matched, because all the rows that have different scope id than `0000-000` (server) or `Null` (local client) are coming from others scope and should not be sent back to the server, for any reason.

Since the `SyncSqliteProvider` is marked as `CanBeServerProvider => false;`, we know that **Sqlite** will never be used as a Server Database.
So far, I guess we can remove this condition in the `Select_Changes` command.

The only concern I have is that this problem (timestamp got messed up on the client side) is applying to **MySql** as well, since the timestamp is generated based on the datetime clock as well...

I will try to remove the sql condition on Sqlite and see if all tests continue to pass.
If there is no problem or regression, it will be available in `v0.6.2`

Will keep you updated.

_Originally posted by @Mimetis in https://github.com/Mimetis/Dotmim.Sync/discussions/453#discussioncomment-380472_

title: #456 - Changing the "applychanges" algorithm to avoid foreign key-con…
body:
…straint violations

#456 is fixed

_Originally posted by @Mimetis in https://github.com/Mimetis/Dotmim.Sync/discussions/453#discussioncomment-380530_

title: Foreign-key friendly way of applying changes
body:
Change the "ApplyChanges" algorithm from

```
For each t tables.Reverse()
     - apply deletes(t)

Foreach t in tables
     - apply upserts(t)
```

to 

```
Foreach t in tables
     - apply inserts(t)
     - apply updates(t)

For each t tables.Reverse()
     - apply deletes(t)
```

... as this will also work with foreign key constraints turned on.
thus..
 - improving performance (no table lock due to disabling/enabling constraints) 🚀
 - while keeping data consitent at the same time ✨

title: SqlSyncChangeTrackingProvider: Auto-increment column - Cannot insert the value NULL
body:
Steps to re-recreate:

1: Create the following table in an empty source database:

```
/****** Object:  Table [dbo].[Person]    Script Date: 2/17/2021 3:02:36 PM ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO

SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO

CREATE TABLE [dbo].[Person](
	[Id] [uniqueidentifier] NOT NULL,
	[LegacyId] [int] IDENTITY(1,1) NOT NULL,
	[FirstName] [nvarchar](256) NOT NULL,
 CONSTRAINT [PK_Person] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED 
(
	[Id] ASC
)WITH (PAD_INDEX = OFF, STATISTICS_NORECOMPUTE = OFF, IGNORE_DUP_KEY = OFF, ALLOW_ROW_LOCKS = ON, ALLOW_PAGE_LOCKS = ON) ON [PRIMARY]
) ON [PRIMARY]
GO

ALTER TABLE [dbo].[Person] ADD  CONSTRAINT [DF_Person_Id]  DEFAULT (newid()) FOR [Id]
GO
```

2: Add a single row of data to the Person table

3: Create an empty target database

4: Enable change tracking on both source and target databases

5: Run the following code:

```
            var sourceProvider = new SqlSyncChangeTrackingProvider("Source");
            var destProvider = new SqlSyncChangeTrackingProvider("Dest");

            var tables = new[] {"Person"};

            var agent = new SyncAgent(destProvider, sourceProvider, tables);

            try
            {
                var result = await agent.SynchronizeAsync();
            }
            catch (Exception ex)
            {
            }
```

Note the exception:

```
Cannot insert the value NULL into column 'LegacyId', table 'Target.dbo.Person'; column does not allow nulls. UPDATE fails.
The statement has been terminated.
```

title: SQlite busy and cancellation token
body:

title: DMS generates SQLite database with case-sensitive primary key from SQL Server with case-insentive primary key
body:
Our SQL Server uses collation `SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS` for which varchar primary keys are by default case-insensitive. SQL Server also ignores trailing blanks in string comparisons, but the generated SQLite database does not. Refer [How SQL Server Compares Strings with Trailing Spaces](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/inf-how-sql-server-compares-strings-with-trailing-spaces-b62b1a2d-27d3-4260-216d-a605719003b0)

So a primary key that is valid on SQLite can cause DMS to throw `SqlException Violation of PRIMARY KEY constraint`  when it tries to sync to SQL Server.

I wonder if when DMS creates the SQLite db it could set the collation (eg `COLLATE NOCASE`) according to the collation on the server? This might help with aligning case-sensitivity, but I'm not sure if this would deal with the trailing blanks.

Or have I missed something?

**EDIT:** Yes I did miss something ... SQLite uses `COLLATE NOCASE` by default. My issue is purely to do with the trailing blanks. Once again I'm shown to be a complete goose

title: Memory leak with batch mode
body:
All batches loaded from server should be released.
The memory leaks is huge on the server side and affects also client side (but a little bit less)

Here is a screen of a memory debug session with version `v0.6` (see upper left corner for memory consumption: 2.8 Gb) : 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4592555/106918930-f227e700-6709-11eb-9db1-37aafe66074a.png)

**Memory Consumption**: `2.8GB`

Currently investigating the issue, and first tests after applying a first fix shows a better memory management:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4592555/106920198-251eaa80-670b-11eb-9850-481b2d80d96b.png)

**MAX Memory Consumption**: `409Mb`
**AVG Memory Consumption**: `210Mb`
**Memory Consumption at the end **: `97Mb`

Will be available in the next release `v0.6.1`

PS: Performance increase is not related to memory leak, but from others tweaks and fixes I'm working on right now

title: SynchronizeAsync trying to insert null in non nullable column
body:
Setup:
- download only
- source db SqlServer
- destination db Sqlite
- initial sync (empty destination db)

Other details
- Could not reproduce on other environments/databases.
- On the same environment, i could reproduce it also for SqlServer destination db

Issue:
- When triggering the initial sync, schema is correctly replicated on destination db
- When trying to sync the rows, an insert statement runs trying to insert a NULL value in a non nullable column (which obviously has value on the source db (column type: bit not null)
- Call stack:
Unhandled exception. Dotmim.Sync.SyncException: SQLite Error 19: 'NOT NULL constraint failed: <not nullable column>'.
 ---> Microsoft.Data.Sqlite.SqliteException (0x80004005): SQLite Error 19: 'NOT NULL constraint failed: <not nullable column>'.
   at Microsoft.Data.Sqlite.SqliteException.ThrowExceptionForRC(Int32 rc, sqlite3 db)
   at Microsoft.Data.Sqlite.SqliteDataReader.NextResult()
   at Microsoft.Data.Sqlite.SqliteCommand.ExecuteReader(CommandBehavior behavior)
   at Microsoft.Data.Sqlite.SqliteCommand.ExecuteReader()
   at Microsoft.Data.Sqlite.SqliteCommand.ExecuteNonQuery()
   at System.Data.Common.DbCommand.ExecuteNonQueryAsync(CancellationToken cancellationToken)
   
  Mitigation:
  - I tried clearing the change tracking cache on the source db => did not work
  - i tried disabling and enabling change tracking on the source db => did not work
  - i updated the dotmim nuget packages from 0.5.7 to 0.6.0 => problem stopped reproducing
  - i downgraded again (just for testing purposes) from 0.6.0 to  0.5.7 => problem stopped reproducing (issue did not come back)
  
  We could not identify a root cause.
  We are currently running with 0.6.0 and the issue is not reproducing anymore, but still it would be nice to identify/reproduce the issue in order to lower the stability concerns.

title: Snapshot + Reinitialize won't work
body:
In some circonstances, Reinitialize a client with a snapshot existing could results in a desync status

- Create a snapshot on server
- Initialize a client database with a first sync: Will create the client db and download the snapshot + delta rows
- Adding a client row `A`
- Sync (`A` is replicated on the server correctly
- Make a `Reinitialize` from the client (will download and reapply the existing snapshot then download dela rows)

Row `A` is not downloading, because this row is marked as client owner (and so far not downloaded again)

Solution:
Should handle the situation and don't call `Select_Changes` stored procedure but a modified `Select_Initialize` stored procedure

Investigation in progress...

I am using Web API to expose my database to my client systems. There are filters on all the tables so that only the relevant information gets sent down to the clients. Luckily, there is only one parameter. The server setup is pretty straight forward affair:

```csharp
services.AddMemoryCache();

var setup = new SyncSetup(SyncSetupHelper.tables);
var options = new SyncOptions();
SyncSetupHelper.AddFilters(setup);

services.AddSyncServer<SqlSyncChangeTrackingProvider>(connectionString, setup);
```

When testing this setup with a Console (.net core), I am not having any issues with syncing with the server (the same code is being used in both Xamarin and Console app):

```csharp

}
do
{

} while (Console.ReadKey().Key != ConsoleKey.Escape);
Console.WriteLine("End");

title: Editing SyncSetup doesn't result in changes using SyncType.Normal. Reinitialize mode for each table instead of globally ?

Hello. 

I'm working on an android application that needs to sync data from a web server using SQL Server to Sqlite. I've been testing a scenario, which should be working judging by the documentation. title: Can be used to sync data from an API instead?
DefaultRequestHeaders is cleared
body:
Using [this suggestion](https://github.com/Mimetis/Dotmim.Sync/issues/326#issuecomment-687146375) to send additional authentication headers from the client to a WebAPI, I found out that in my ASP.NET Core WebAPI endpoint the headers I added are gone.

Looking deeper at HttpRequestHander, I found out that [in line 81, the headers are cleared](https://github.com/Mimetis/Dotmim.Sync/blob/8398114ee904a1da8b488f89a5d250bdf8ffb94c/Projects/Dotmim.Sync.Web.Client/HttpRequestHandler.cs#L81):

    client.DefaultRequestHeaders.Clear();

As far as I could find out this is the reason why my headers do not arrive on the server.

### My question

Is there any other way for me to add additional headers to every request from the client to the server via WebAPI?

title: #300 - fixing issue causing dataloss when server session is lost whil…
body:
…e client sends additional batches # 1 - solves data loss issue The issue is, that the `WebServerOrchestrator` just creates a new `clientBatchInfo` if it is null. The issue with this is: If you send changes in batches and the server session is lost (e.g. due to an ApplicationPool recycle or because the Redis cache was cleared), it will just forget all the batches that were already sent during the ongoing session! See the following sequencediagram for clarification: ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Client participant Server loop GetLocalChanges Client->>Client: create 2 batch files (b0, b1, b2) end Client->>Server: Send b0 Note right of Server: session is lost
=> clientBatchInfo is null Client->>Server: Send b1 Client->>Server: Send b2 loop ApplyChanges Server->>Server: deserialize all batches and apply to database Note right of Server: Only inserts b1 and b2!
b0 changes are forever lost! end ``` The only thing I had to add to fix this is a null-check: ```diff // ------------------------------------------------------------ // FIRST STEP : receive client changes // ------------------------------------------------------------ + // ensure that the blientBatchInfo is still available in the session - it **must** only be null when the batchIndex is 0!! + if (sessionCache.ClientBatchInfo == null && httpMessage.BatchIndex != 0) + throw new SyncException("Session loss: No batchPartInfo could found for the current sessionId. It seems the session was lost. Please try again."); // We are receiving changes from client // BatchInfo containing all BatchPartInfo objects // Retrieve batchinfo instance if exists // Get batch info from session cache if exists, otherwise create it if (sessionCache.ClientBatchInfo == null) sessionCache.ClientBatchInfo = new BatchInfo(clientWorkInMemory, Schema, this.Options.BatchDirectory); ``` Interestingly, your code **does** check whether the session is empty when the client is **requesting** additional batches. So I just added a test to cover the fact that this will also not break in the future. # 2 `HttpMessageSendChangesRequestArgs` takes a `byte[]` - what for? I had to implement "OnReceiveChanges" interception Why is the parameter `HttpMessageSendChangesRequestArgs` of `OnSendChanges` taking the binary data as a parameter? I would argue, that when I do intercept this call, I would like to see what changes are sent. But in the current implementation, I only do get a byte array. The only thing I could think of was to manipulate this array to e.g. add another layer of compression/encryption. Is that the intention? As I did not see any real sense in that, I removed this. Instead (and also in order to create an integration test for this scenario) I changed the constructor to take a `HttpMessageSendChangesRequest` as a parameter instead of the `byte[]`: ``` public class HttpMessageSendChangesRequestArgs : ProgressArgs { public HttpMessageSendChangesRequestArgs(HttpMessageSendChangesRequest request) { ... } } ``` Likewhise, I had to add `HttpMessageSendChangesRequest` to the `HttpMessageSendChangesRequestArgs` Additionally, the Interception happens **before** the changes are serialized. That way, the interceptor can actually *modify* the changes sent to the server! # 3 - Added integration test to ensure deferred transaction are never used by SqliteSyncProvider Additionally, I added a specific integration test that ensures that the SqliteSyncProvider does **not** use deferred transactions when selecting local changes as this can also lead to data loss in the future!

title: Integation tests are not properly isolated per client
body:
The integration tests (e.g. SqlServerHttpTests) are not properly isolated:

Each tests runs *every* client implementation.

Because there is just one test for all clients (foreach (var client in Clients)) I had to calculate the number of rows that should be downloaded by the 2nd client or present on the server after the 2nd client synced...
I already split the tests to isolate them by client in my repository. 
See [here](https://github.com/gentledepp/Dotmim.Sync/tree/feature/7_splittests)
A pull request will follow somewhere in the future!

title: Cannot sync a many to many table with extra column
body:
I have a many to many table that is an association table between two other tables. At first all was fine and it synced happily over http between a client Sqlite database and an MS SQL Server database. The table had two columns forming the primary key which were foreign keys to the other tables.
I then added a third column (varchar(50) and now it won't sync. The table structures from the server are downloaded to the client if I synchronise using SyncType.Reinitialize and all initially looks OK.
When I insert a new row to the client table this is updated correctly into the sqlite database. However when I then perform a normal sync I get_ the following exception:
{Dotmim.Sync.SyncException: Trying to pass a table-valued parameter with 3 column(s) where the corresponding user-defined table type requires 2 column(s).  at Dotmim.Sync.Web.Client.HttpRequestHandler.HandleSyncError

I've tried resetting everything multiple times to no avail.
I'm using the 0.5.8 beta version as initially the third column was a blob field, and this version has a fix to support this. However I get the same issue with 0.5.7.

I'd be very grateful if anyone could help.

Is there a way to either create the stored procedures manually, or to force reinitialization?

title: Multi-level synchronization
body:
I am experimenting with your framework and am trying to determine whether it can support multi-level synchronization. I have two-level sync working, using SqlServer to SqlServer as well as Sqlite to SqlServer. I am using the web components and everything seems like it is working OK.

However, when I try to have something like this:

SqlServer (A)
-syncs to-
SqlServer (B)
-syncs to-
Sqlite (C)

It seems like it doesn't work. So for example with empty DBs: 
- I sync B to A, then sync C to B, to "register" everything. 
- Then I create Item #1 in B, and sync B to A. This works, Item #1 is in A&B
- Then I sync C to B. Still good, now Item 1 is in A, B and C.
- Now I create Item #2 in C. I sync, it indicates that changes have been uploaded. Checking in the B DB, I see the item is actually there.
- Now, I sync B to A, expecting #2 to move to A. It says 0 changes have been uploaded. Checking in A DB confirms the item is not in A. 

It's as if the sync process doesn't see the item #2 in DB B as tracked or something. 

I know this is longwinded I am just trying to understand if this multi-level scenario is feasible. Thank you.

title: Question - Is it possible to have different client side schema to server when rolling out update?
body:
I hope it's okay to post a question here!

I am working on a .NET client application that needs to sync data from a cloud server through a WEB API. We are currently doing this by using a modified date column in the SQL Server database but this is proving problematic! Your framework may just be the answer :-) I have been looking for a long time for something like this framework - it really is excellent but there is one thing I can't quite figure out from reading the docs and making some test applications.

Let's say my clients are all on version 0.1 and have a particular schema. All clients talk to my WEB API v0.1 and everything works great. I then have a new version of my WEB API, v0.2, with new tables and columns that I need to add to my sync. However, I don't want my clients running v0.1 to get these new tables and columns. I only want those new columns and tables to be synced with clients running a new v0.2 of the software, and I want to roll out my new v0.2 version slowly to all clients. So there will be a period of time where my v0.1 clients will be connecting to my v0.2 WEB API. Is this possible? Any time I've tried changing my server side like this it seems to breaks the client side. The only way that I can think to get it to work is to create a new application in IIS for each WEB API release so that they are completely separate URLs. 

Apologies if I have missed something in the docs that explains this but all of the examples suggest that the server and client need to always have the same schema.

title: Unhandled exception: Microsoft.Data.SqlClient is not supported on this platform.
Send is not supported in the Windows Runtime SynchronizationContext
body:
**Description**
Trying to sync my local sqlite database on Windows UWP throws the error: Send is not supported in the Windows Runtime SynchronizationContext. 

**StackTrace**
`Dotmim.Sync.SyncException: Send is not supported in the Windows Runtime SynchronizationContext ---> System.NotSupportedException: Send is not supported in the Windows Runtime SynchronizationContext
   at System.Threading.WinRTSynchronizationContextBase.Send(SendOrPostCallback d, Object state)
   at Dotmim.Sync.SynchronousProgress`1.OnReport(T value)
   at Dotmim.Sync.SynchronousProgress`1.System.IProgress<T>.Report(T value)
   at Dotmim.Sync.BaseOrchestrator.ReportProgress(SyncContext context, IProgress`1 progress, ProgressArgs args, DbConnection connection, DbTransaction transaction)
   at Dotmim.Sync.LocalOrchestrator.BeginSessionAsync(CancellationToken cancellationToken, IProgress`1 progress)
   at Dotmim.Sync.SyncAgent.SynchronizeAsync(SyncType syncType, CancellationToken cancellationToken, IProgress`1 progress)`

**Extra Info**
I found this in the Microsoft Docs.

```
Exceptions
NotSupportedException
The method was called in a Windows Store app. The implementation of SynchronizationContext for Windows Store apps does not support the Send(SendOrPostCallback, Object) method.
```

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.threading.synchronizationcontext.send?view=netcore-3.1

It appears using POST instead of SEND may solve the problem.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.threading.synchronizationcontext.post?view=netcore-3.1


**Information**
IDE and IDE version: Visual Studio 2019 v16.4.4 Windows (Windows 10 Pro, version 1903)
Platform with the issue:
Windows UWP

title: Slow performance when syncing a table with GUID PK
body:
Hey @Mimetis 

I've been using Dotmim.Sync 0.3.0 in my project for a while and decided to test the latest version 0.5.6. I'm having a problem with slow performance for tables with a GUID PK syncing from SQL Server to Sqlite over HTTP. I made a little chart to compare Dotmim.Sync 0.3.0 vs 0.5.6. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39327472/91123019-25883380-e6df-11ea-9faa-d361419838d8.png)

The chart shows the older version completes ~355K rows in about 4 mins. However the new version (0.5.6) takes 3 hrs 24 mins for the same data getting progressively slower for each batch. I'm using a GUID PK in some of the tables in my application to avoid a sync conflict on the server. Both data sets were collected with Microsoft.Data.Sqlite 3.1.3. 

If I do a heavy sync from a table with an int PK performance is good. Nothing to see there.

I create a complete sqlite db in one heavy sync and ship that inside a desktop installer. The app is used to rollout and maintain emergency radio equipment for firefighters in Victoria, Australia.

A complete sync normally takes around 10 minutes but the new version blows out to more than 6 hrs in total. The performance is just as bad if I use a snapshot because the bottle neck is inserting data into sqlite and not transfering the data across HTTP. 

Btw great to see 0.5.6 is now much faster across HTTP. 

Not sure if this is relevant but Microsoft.Data.Sqlite >= verison 3.0.0 now stores GUIDs as text and not binary. https://www.bricelam.net/2019/08/22/microsoft-data-sqlite-3-0.html

More than happy to retest performance if you make changes.

Regards,
Guy

 have a nice day.

title: Strange behavior on synchronization
body:
We are using your **syncronization** components and we tried out, in some cases, a **strange behavior**!
We need help to understand if the behavior is correct or if there is a bug.

We have a client that works offline and that periodically synchronize with a server (with the purge of the metadata on client side (CleanMetadatas=true)). The user can use both to read and update entities.
The client uses SQLite for persistence and the server uses SQL Server. Both use EF Core for the data access layer and we prepare the DB using the EF migrations.

The tested scenarios are:

1. **we delete a record X on the client side, we change the same record on the server side** and then we execute the synchronization from the client: 
> we expected a RemoteExistsLocalIsDelete conflict, but we receive RemotedIsDeletedLocalIsDeleted and 
> - if we choice, on the server side, in the OnApplyChangesFailed code, the ServerWins conflict resolution, the synchronization completes successfully.
> - if we choice the ClientWins, the synchronization completes without errors but without changes applied: the server has the record but the client not.


2. **we delete a record X on the server side, we change the same record on the client side** and then we execute the synchronization from the client:
> we expected RemoteIsDeletedLocalExists conflict but we receive RemoteExistsLocalExists and
> - if we choice the ServerWins, the synchronization completes without errors but without changes applied: the client has the record but the server not.

3. **what’s meaning of RemoteIsDeletedLocalIsDeleted conflict?** Why does it throw this conflict if client and server deletes the same record?

4. **we add a new record on the server side, update it on the server side** and then we execute the synchronization from the client:
> - if we choice, on server side, in the OnApplyChangesFailed code, the ServerWins or ClientWins conflict resolution, the synchronization completes successfully.
> - if we choice the ConflictResolution.Rollback, the synchronization fails. Why is there a conflict? what's the meaning of RemoteExistsLocalNotExists?
   
5. **we add a new record on the server side, delete it on the server side** and then we execute the synchronization from the client:
> - if we choice the ConflictResolution.Rollback the synchronization fails but we don't receive the conflict, the RemoteIsDeletedLocalNotExists conflict. What's the meaning of RemoteIsDeletedLocalNotExists?
   
6. **is there a way to manage the synchronization of a record with relationships (with foreign key)?**
> we add a child record, on the client side, to an existing parent record, delete the parent record on the server side then we execute the synchronization on the client:
> - regardless we choice the ClientWins or ServerWins, the synchronization completes without errors, the parent record is deleted but the child not. So, we have an orphan child record!

7. **we delete a record X on the client side, after we update the same record on the server side and add a child record Y. Why in this case the conflict type is RemoteIsDeletedLocalIsDeleted?** 
> - if we choice the ClientWins, the records X and Y are not deleted.

8. **we update a record X on the client side and add a child Y, after we delete, on the server side, the record X**. Then we execute the synchronization from the client:
> - if we choice ServerWins or ClientWins, the record X is deleted from both sides, instead the record Y is persisted on client and server like an orphan child. There was no conflict generated.

9. **we add, on the client side, a child record Y to an existing record X, after we add, on the server side, a record Z to the record X, in the end we delete the entity X and Z on server.** Then we execute the synchronization from the client:
> - if we choice ServerWins or ClientWins, there is a resolved conflict, but the event OnApplyChangesFailed is never triggered. For this reason, the conflict type is unknown. Like result the orphan record Y was not cancelled and was persisted even on server. 

10. **we add, on the client side, a child record Y, after we delete the entity X on the client side, on server we add a child record Z to X. Why in this case the conflict type is 
 RemoteIsDeletedLocalIsDeleted?**
> - if we choice the ClientWins, no changes was applied on the client and the server side and after synchronization. 


To give to user a greater control on syncronization we need **some other features**:
- we need to **set the conflict resolution policy on the client sinde** at each synchronization.
> in details, we would 
> - start, from the client, a first synchronization with a rollback conflict resolution;
> - leave to user the choice of the resolution strategy to use;
> - start, from the client, a second synchronization with a conflict resolution choosed from the user;
> do we have to send a SyncParamenter from client to server and use it on OnApplyChangesFailed on server?

- is there a way to **get all the conflicts** to show to the user?

- is there a way to know if **there is something to synchronize**?

Say I have table name AbpUsers which have TenantId [NULL Bool Column], I would like to have query like this : 
`Select * from AbpUsers where TenantId=@TenantIdOR TenantId IS NULL`

I have used filters like this:

``` cs
//----- Filters 
SetupFilter userFilter = new SetupFilter("AbpUsers");
userFilter.AddParameter("TenantId", DbType.Int64,false);
userFilter.AddWhere("TenantId", "AbpUsers", "TenantId");
userFilter.AddCustomerWhere("TenantId IS NULL");
setup.Filters.Add(userFilter);`
```
This  is creating stored procedure like: 

``` cs
WHERE
 (
   ([base].[TenantId] = @TenantId)
  )

AND
(
  TenantId IS NULL
)
```

title: Dotmim.Sync.SyncException: Index was outside the bounds of the array.
Support SQL-Server "Synonym"
body:
Hi,
we have an exisiting application with different table names on client and server with the same column definitions. We can't rename tables on either side easily. 

My Idea was to use sql server synonyms (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/t-sql/statements/create-synonym-transact-sql) to have equal table names.

Synonyms are supported by the t-sql CHANGETABLE command (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/relational-databases/system-functions/changetable-transact-sql):
"The table name can be a synonym to the table"

Unfortunately Dotmim throws an "table does not exist" error at agent.SynhronizeAsync().

Is there a possibilty for us to solve our problem without renaming the tables?

Best!
Alex from Berlin

title: Handling Offline record recreation with auto increment Primary Key
body:
Hi, I was wondering if Dotmim.Sync has a way to handle the a scenario I would need. I tried searching the docs, but didn't find what I was looking for.

I have an application that has a MS SQL as a remote server and SQLite as the local database. There are occasions where the client application will not have network connectivity and will need to create records on the local table and sync the data at a later time. There is also the very likely possibility that multiple client applications will be creating records to the table during this time span. The table in question has a simple ID column that is set as the primary key and auto increments.

My question is specifically handle the following scenario:

Client A and Client B sync Table 1 at the same time so they both have an identical copy of the remote data stored into an SQLite local DB. Table 1 has the last record ID of 505. Client A uses the application without an internet connection and adds a new record to Table 1. In sqlite, it is assigned the row ID of 506. Client B has a stable internet connection and inserts a new row into Table 1 and is assigned the row ID of 506 and sync's without issue.  Some time later, Client A gets back to a stable internet connection and sync's the data. 

In my test of this scenario, dotmim.sync will try to add the record to the remote Db, notices that there is a record with row ID 506 already existing and will resolve the conflict with the server winning and client A's data being discarded. 

What I am hoping to accomplish is for dotmim.sync to somehow realize (or for me to somehow notate) that Client A's 506 record was newly created created locally and that it is a different record than the remote DB's 506 (originating from Client B) so it should insert Client A's record into the remote DB with a new ID (ie 507) and then update Client A's local database to match the remote DB.

Is there someway to accomplish this in Dotmim.sync (or some way I could accomplish this by handling the Primary Key differently)?

Hi,
     I tried to sync a SQL SERVER database model that holds a table with a XML column using the trigger model. I recieved this error:  _The XML data type cannot be compared or sorted, except when using the IS NULL operator_. I configured the framework to exclude the xml column and it works ok.
    I isolated the bug to the update trigger creation. It seems that IFNULL term doesn't work with XML columns. Have you considered using  COALESCE expression instead? I attached the table script that reproduces the error and a code template for the trigger for your consideration.  Thanks in advance!

title: What would be missing to have a full feature sync framework ?
body:
Hey guyz.

I've finally reach a point, where I've almost done all the features I wanted to develop for this framework.

I still have some more things to add, like:
- An **advanced filter management**, where changing a value from a filter, should remove the lines from any client that is not any more part of the filter.
I tried several solutions to get a universal solution that will work in almost all cases, but it's really, really really hard .... So far, I've no idea if I will be able to implement such system...

title: v0.5 Bringing back scope_info to Server side
body:
One *new* feature from `v0.4` was to drop the `scope_info` table from the server side.

The main reason was another new feature: In `v0.4` only the client is responsible of the starting point of its own sync session.
Eventually server does not care of any *client start point in time*.
That's why we did not need the `scope_info` table on the server side for handling start and end of sync.
It means a lot of simplicity for handling clients. Because the server is *agnostic* to any clients.

But...

We miss so much information on the server side, that why I've decided to bring the `scope_info` back in the server database.

Even more, the `v0.5` will bring **2** new tables:
- `scope_info_server` : This table will contains the schema declared in your code.
- `scope_info_history`: This table will contains the last sync session from any client, for info.

### scope_info_server

As I said, this table contains some useful informations:
- *sync_scope_name*: Identifier. Each scope name represents a schema
- *sync_scope_schema*: Actual schema

Since we have the schema declared by code, why having schema in database ? 
Well one main reason for that is to be able to recreate portion of the `Dotmim.Sync` sql components when you are making some changes in your coded schema...
Supposing you're adding (or removing) a table from your `SyncSetup`, in your code:

```
// Actually we are using these tables
// var setup = new SyncSetup(new string[] { "Address", "Customer", "CustomerAddress", "SalesOrderHeader", "SalesOrderDetail" });

// Now I need also Product !
var setup = new SyncSetup(new string[] { "Product", "Address", "Customer", "CustomerAddress", "SalesOrderHeader", "SalesOrderDetail" });
```
Today, you have to manually `DeprovisionAsync()` and `ProvisionAsync()` again your whole database.
It could be really complicated...

The idea is to be able to compare your coded schema with the last schema stored in the database.
Then make all mandatories operations in the databse to be sure everything will run smoothly.

- *sync_scope_last_clean_timestamp*: Last time the metadatas for all tables involved in this schema have been deleted.

Now that we can delete metadatas in the tracking tables, we need to be sure that any client who will try to sync its database has its *last time successful* sync time greater than *last cleanup metadatas*


### scope_info_history

This scope table will contains one line per client. Each line will have the last time the client tried to sync.
This table is pretty much the same as the actual `scope_info` table stored on the client:

- *sync_scope_name* : Scope name.
- *scope_last_sync_timestamp*: last **server** timestamp.
- *scope_last_sync_duration*: last **server** duration (Basically how much time to apply client batches and get back server changes)
- *scope_last_sync*: last **server** sync datetime.

FYI, The `scope_info` table from contains the same columns, plus one **client** column representing the client timestamp.

## Your thoughts ?

I'm actually working on this feature. 
But I'm pretty sure I miss some useful information that can be stored in these 2 tables.
What kind of info do you think we should save in these new tables ?

title: Feature: Clients reinitialize after some retention period
body:
Typically, sync frameworks produce a lot of tracking data that has to be cleaned up some time.
E.g. when a row is deleted, the metadata row in the _tracking table is still being kept.

This is to ensure, that clients that synchronize sometime in the future still get that deletion delivered to them.

However, at some point this metadata has to be removed from the system - otherwise the sql query time could degrade or the database could run full.

Possible solution: A configurable retention period per scope.

- in the server-side configuration a retention period can be specified (default: 4 weeks?)
- all _tracking tables of toombstoned records are only kept for 4 weeks and deleted thereafter
- each client sends the last time it synchronized a particular scope to the server
- if the server sees, that the client has last synced +4 weeks ago, it will return an error message, that the client needs to reinitialize
- the client then reinitializes the scope

Do you think this could be in the scope for Dotmim.Sync?
Basically one could implement this separately, but it feels like this could be a natural feature of Dotmim.Sync.
