Fix .Net Core30 Compatibility issues
body:
Found two issues for compatibility with **.Net Core 3.0** (especially in **ASP.Net Core 3.0**)

- Fix issue with `.Net Core 3.0` and new forbidden rule for synchronous IO call from ASP.NET: https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/issues/7644

All call to `ISerializer` are now asynchronous

- Fix issue on `.Net Core 3.0` regression https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/issues/17973

Remove references in `Dotmim.Sync.Web.Server` to `Microsoft.AspNetCore`

body:

This fixes it:
public static IWebHost BuildWebHost(string[] args) =>
    WebHost.CreateDefaultBuilder(args)
        .UseStartup<Startup>()
        .UseKestrel(o => { o.Limits.KeepAliveTimeout = TimeSpan.FromMinutes(10); })
        .Build();


The webconfig setting only appears to work when deployed / running in release mode

title: 0.4 basic filter not working
Hello @Mimetis, I am having a similar issue trying to sync a table that has a computed column as primary key, the error looks like this:
body:
Hello @Mimetis, I am having a similar issue trying to sync a table that has a computed column as primary key, the error looks like this:
 ```Incorrect syntax near ','.```


Below is the definition of my table:
CREATE TABLE [dbo].[TableA](
	[id]  AS (isnull([idgenerator]+(1),(0))) PERSISTED NOT NULL,
	[name] [nchar](10) NOT NULL,
	[siteid] [int] NOT NULL,
	[idgenerator] [int] IDENTITY(1,1) NOT NULL,
 CONSTRAINT [PK_TableA] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED 
(
	[id] ASC
)WITH (PAD_INDEX = OFF, STATISTICS_NORECOMPUTE = OFF, IGNORE_DUP_KEY = OFF, ALLOW_ROW_LOCKS = ON, ALLOW_PAGE_LOCKS = ON, OPTIMIZE_FOR_SEQUENTIAL_KEY = OFF) ON [PRIMARY]
) ON [PRIMARY]
GO

Could you help me please??

_Originally posted by @yodiaz87 in https://github.com/Mimetis/Dotmim.Sync/issues/202#issuecomment-582116856_

title: Mimetis snapshot
Must declare the scalar variable.
body:
Hi There
I'm new to Dotmim.Sync, i have setup my connections to my SQL express database and to my local SQLlite database and am busy trying to do my first sync. I had a few errors which were easy to resolve, the messages clearly told my which tables needed primary keys etc. I'm now getting a new error but nowhere can i see which table its complaining about. The error is

"incorrect syntax near the keyword NULL,
must declare the scalar variable "@sync_scope_id"

How can i find out which table this error is occurring on ?
many thanks

title: 0.4 set table to sync with from client
body:
I have some specific scenarios which require client to control tables to sql with and the filters.

Example:before login, sync with only language table.

After login , sync with table xyz.

When switching tables I need the data in previous sync tables to be retained till I run specific sync on those tables

ALTER DATABASE DotMimSyncv4Server4  
SET CHANGE_TRACKING = ON

still created t[tablename]

Have to shut the client down before trying again.

0.3 appears to show progress however there is no progress in the console with version 0.4?

title: Filters: master detail
body:
Is there a way to have a filter on master table then only records in master and detail tables are synchronised based on foreign key relationship between two tables.

Example: master table is a security table indication what records a user had access to. The detail table has the records.

It’s a way to create row base security

Master detail inserts on client - how do id’s get synchronised with server so integrity is maintained.

Table1
Id - int (primary key)
Title

Table 2:
Id - int (primary key)

Title

agent.Parameters.Add("CustomerData", "OrgId", OrgId);

v0.4 seems to use addRange but no clear indication of how to use?
agent.Parameters.AddRange?

title: <head><title>413 Request Entity Too Large</title></head>
body:
Running locally would sync fine with 10000 rows.

Deployed to AWS (good server spec) - ran sync again fails with error: <head><title>413 Request Entity Too Large</title></head>

Tried updating buffer to 50 - still failed.

Scaled down the number of rows to 10 - Sync runs fine.

Help!

title: sync with SQL View - one way
body: Is there a way to have a sql view on the server and sync 1 way to client. Reason: SQL view allows creating some additional logic to output view of data.

title: version 0.4 - please set the .net core runtime to version 3
body:
hosting providers have .net core 3.0 deployed by default. I tried upgrading your project to .net core 3.0 and there are a number of issues.

They could be bugs in R0.4 

to make the transition easier to .net core3.0 maybe you should upgrade and test it for .net core 3.0 to start with.

title: Sync - multi TimeZone scenario
body:
If I have multiple clients each running different timezones.

Will the sync work correctly?

i.e. does it always use UTC when syncronizing?

title: filtering by a collection of items when sync runs
body:
I have a security requirement to ensure users only get access to specific customer data.

For this I would have either a SQL View or list of CustomerID's each user can sync with.

from what I can tell the filter is only allowing 1 item to be filtered at a time.

What if I need to give a user sync with customer record A, B, H, J.

extract from the documents:
agent.Parameters.Add("ServiceTickets", "CustomerID", 10);

Is it possible to do something like this in a filter:
agent.Parameters.Add("ServiceTickets", "CustomerID", [A, B, H, J]);

OR give it the name of a security stored proc or security SQLView that will return a list of customerID's the user can sync with.

title: console App - Sync via WebAPI - after a few sync's keep getting n: There is already an open DataReader associated with this Command which must be closed first.. Type:InvalidOpe
body: Setup the sample app sync server and sync console. Run few a few times then ": There is already an open DataReader associated with this Command which must be closed first.. " Is there a way to kill these data readers automatically in the code? see attached image

title: Documentation issue - Direction
MySql trigger builder fix
body:

[Enhancement/Question] Differ the sync
body:
In a classic setup with a central database called the Master, getting requests from different clients :
is there a way  to be able to "differ" the sync (maybe with sync configuration parameters but i don't think) ?
As in : get the last changes from the Master server without uploading the new things from the client to the Master.

The idea behind that is to be able to have a kind of "pending" work on the client, and only commit it when the user decides it, BUT the client still need to get "fresh" datas from the Master regularly. The thing is right now, if we "sync" and there's no conflict, everything will be uploaded and downloaded.

As an added (so 2nd) feature to that : while getting the datas from the Master, if there are conflicts, let the client choose "keep mine" or "take server" but still not commit changes immediately to the Master. Right now it is of course possible to intercept conflicts but that would mean "postpone" them and still choose a resolution everytime we would get datas from the Master.

Thanks

title: Sqlite Encryption
[Critical] Data not sent to server
body:
We found another critical bug.

Say client A inserts a row R1 locally and synchronizes with the server S.
The sync works perfectly but when A tries to store the scope_last_sync_timestamp locally, it crashes.

So now we've got row R1 inserted on the client and the server, but client A does not know that anymore.

- In case client A synchronizes the next time, R1 is transmitted as INSERT to the server again, which rejects the INSERT as the row already exists.
That is basically no problem.

BUT (and there is always a but...)
- In case the row R1 is **updated** on the client, before it synchronizes, then the client will determine, that R1 still has to be transmitted as INSERT to the server (even though there was actually an update on the row.)
This is due to the following code in CoreProvider.GetChanges.cs `GetStateFromDmRow`:
```csharp
  
else if (scopeInfo.IsNewScope || (isLocallyCreated && createdTimeStamp >= scopeInfo.Timestamp))
                    dmRowState = DmRowState.Added;

```
Now the problem is, that the server will reject the change, as the row already exists in the server database.
The problem: The UPDATE will **never** reach the server, except the row is updated again after the second sync!

title: [Bug] - Deletion does not take foreign key constraints into account
body:
As of now, all tables are synced in the order that is provided in the sync configuration.

Let's assume we have two tables: 
- Order
- OrderDetail

Now OrderDetail has a foreign key which points to Order.
For that reason, we have to configure the sync as such, that the Order table is synchronized first, and the OrderDetail table thereafter.
Otherwise, it could happen that the sync process tries to insert an OrderDetail for an Order which does not exist in the local database yet.

So far so good. According to the current implementation, each sync process goes as follows:
For each table:
1. insert all new rows
2. update all changed rows
3. delete all tombstoned rows

This brings us to the following problem.
Let's assume, that we delete an Order and the OrderDetail that references it.
What happens is
For the Order table:
1. all new rows are inserted
2. all changed rows are updated
3. the database refuses to delete the Order, because the OrderDetail is still referencing it (it has not been deleted yet)

So what should happen is:
For each table:
1. insert all new rows
2. update all changed rows

When that is done, go through all tables again **in reverse order** and delete the tombstoned rows.

title: [Enhancement] Multiple performance improvements
body:
Hi!
This is just an open list of performance improvements that can be implemented.
Some of them were already implemented by us in our branch as we had some serious issues #154 . Hopefully, we'll find the time to send you PRs eventually.


1. fix #154 
2. ObjectNameConverter could cache its instances based on the input text. With 1000 rows synced in our test, this reduced the `ParseString` calls from over 9000 to 34.
3. Reduce the number of request-response roundtrips between client and server. In the best case, it'd be just one request response if batching is disabled (Have a look at the [fallacies of distributed computing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fallacies_of_distributed_computing) to understand why)
4. Reuse the DbCommands that come from `DbSyncAdapter.GetCommand` and just re-apply the parameters. This greatly improves performance as the command text does not have to be parsed anymore, which has a huge impact on mobile devices using SQLite (see: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/670407/reusing-sqlcommand and [example by microsoft](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.data.sqlclient.sqlcommand.prepare?redirectedfrom=MSDN&view=netframework-4.8#System_Data_SqlClient_SqlCommand_Prepare))
5. ScopeInfoBuilder should not read **all** scopes, but only the local scope and the client scope (if `ClientReferenceId` is provided). Currently, if 2000 clients were ever connected to the server, 1998 rows are loaded into memory for nothing!
6. cache the database table schema so unnecessary `ReadSchemaAsync` calls are avoided.
7. SyncAgent - instead of downloading all batches first, and applying them later, while downloading the next batch, apply the current one
8. SyncAgend - support different BatchSizeInKB for uploads and downloads, because the upload bandwidth of a network is most of the time much more limited than the download bandwidth.

I will update this list whenever we find something new.

title: SQLite adapter sometimes does not send changes back to the server
body:
Hi!

we have some weird issues in our system.
**Scenario**
Users get a task and once they compete it, they are to flag them as completed and then synchronize so the server gets the status update as well.

**Problem**
the sync never gives us any errors but sometimes (very rarely - like once in a week) one to two tasks are marked as completed on the client, but are still new on the server.
Even though we did a fresh sync.
Now we went through the code and it is impossible that this is due to a sync conflit: There are no foreign key constraints that could be violated, nor is there any way the task could have changed on the server.

**Solution**
So I am having this weird feeling, that there may be an issue with the timestamp handling on the client side. I am currently investigating and try to do a PR if I find an issue.

However, I do not completely understand the select changed query on sqlite. Could you please explain it a little more?
I took the query form the integration tests sample.
```
SELECT 	[side].[ServiceTicketID], 
	[base].[Title], 
	[base].[Description], 
	[base].[StatusValue], 
	[base].[EscalationLevel], 
	[base].[Opened], 
	[base].[Closed], 
	[base].[CustomerID], 
	[side].[sync_row_is_tombstone], 
	[side].[create_scope_id], 
	[side].[create_timestamp], 
	[side].[update_scope_id], 
	[side].[update_timestamp] 
FROM [ServiceTickets_tracking] [side]
LEFT JOIN [ServiceTickets] [base]
ON [base].[ServiceTicketID] = [side].[ServiceTicketID]
WHERE (
	-- Update made by the local instance
	[side].[update_scope_id] IS NULL
	-- Or Update different from remote
        -- isn't the local scope always null?
	OR [side].[update_scope_id] <> @sync_scope_id
	-- Or we are in reinit mode so we take rows even thoses updated by the scope
        -- if we reinit, shouldn't we send everything to the server?
       -- because this way, the change is still only sent if the other two clause-groups apply
      -- meaning the row must be newer than the remove timestamp
	OR @sync_scope_is_reinit = 1
    )
AND (
	-- And Timestamp is > from remote timestamp
	[side].[timestamp] > @sync_min_timestamp --int64
	OR
	-- remote instance is new, so we don't take the last timestamp
-- what is remote here? SQLIte, or do you mean the remote MSSQL Server
	@sync_scope_is_new = 1
	)
AND (
 -- i assume this means that we send changes
 -- if this is a deleted row
-- or the row is not deleted, and there actually exists the original row in the tracked table
-- (which causes this to be ignored if the row was not deleted but is not present? Does that make sense at all?)
	[side].[sync_row_is_tombstone] = 1 
	OR
	([side].[sync_row_is_tombstone] = 0 AND [base].[ServiceTicketID] is not null	)
)

```

Please enlighten me if you find a minute or two :-)

title: Add better exception messages
body:
Hi,

for better exception handling and for fixing problem faster, it would be neat if the thrown exception would include more precise messages. 
For example:

> Table {TableDescription.TableName} must have at least one dmColumn as Primary key"

Is thrown often within CreateTable, CreateForeignKeys, CreateTriggers.. it would be good if the taken action is included within the message, so the developer knows what excactly went wrong (or at least at which action)

Suggestion: 

> Create database: Table {TableDescription.TableName} must have at least one dmColumn as Primary key"

> Create trigger: Table {TableDescription.TableName} must have at least one dmColumn as Primary key"


Another example:

> There is already an open DataReader associated with this Command which must be closed first

This actually tells me that a second reader is activated. Either "MultipleActiveResultSets=true;" is not set or the tables are synchronized in the wrong order, right? 

Suggestion if MultipleActiveResultSets=false:

> There is already an open DataReader associated with this Command which must be closed first. Try setting MultipleActiveResultSets to true.

Suggestion if MultipleActiveResultSets=true:

> There is already an open DataReader associated with this Command which must be closed first. Seems like you specified a wrong order for you tables. Check your constraints and reorder the tables in your configuration.

In accordance to this problem, wouldn't it be nice if you must not specify all tables that you wish to be synced? Like, if I pass null or do not specify any table, all tables should be synced? (Algorithm to determine the correct order to sync tables by foreign key analysis. How the hell does that work?)

[Enhancement] - allow to provide a factory func for httpclient so it can be shared for performance reasons
body:
I recently came across the following blog post about the correct usage of HttpClient in conjunction with Xamarin.


They propose to use and share one single instance of HttpClient per server, that is communicated with, as it is intended to be used this way.

Also they mention, that one should **not** set ones own HttpRequestHandler, as Xamarin normally automagically sets platform-native versions (Android and iOS) which are much faster than the built-in handlers.

Have a look at the [well written blog post](http://jonathanpeppers.com/Blog/improving-http-performance-in-xamarin-applications)

title: [Bug] Cannot sync updated FK that refers to new row on client db
body:
Steps to reproduce
- Deploy AdventureWorks db to SQL Server
- Sync to Sqlite db on client
- Create a new Product row in AdventureWorks SQL Server db
- Sync new Product to client db
- Create a new ProductCategory on client db
- Set the ProductCategoryID FK on the new Product to be the new ProductCategory on client db
- Sync back to the server
- Inspect the new Product row and observe ProductCategoryID FK is NULL on the server db. It should have been updated.

I traced the problem to the order of Update and Insert. Each of these actions occurs in table order as expected. However a FK constraint exception occurred on the server side when a FK update was executed on the Product row before the insert of the new ProductCategory row. The solution would be to execute both Update and Insert for a given table in order and not all Updates in order then all Inserts in order. 

The problem was difficult to find because everything looked correct from the client side. One row was created and one updated. However the FK constraint exception was silently eaten on the server side. A conflict was logged on the server side but this is not actually a conflict. The server side should throw the exception so that the client is notified of the problem.

@Mimetis happy to put up a PR. I have made some changes and created a test on my fork which I think will work.

Regards,
Guy

title: [Critical] - Another situation in the moment of synchronization.
body:
I started to use it in production with 60 tables. I noticed that sometimes some new rows are not synchronized. The synchronization takes about 15 seconds. I tested through the sourcing code and noticed something in the EnumerateChangesInternal method. 
This method checks all tables for eventual changes. The problem occurs in this case - while checking the tables takes place if a new row is added to an already checked table, then that new row will not be synchronized. This is something like a "race condition" problem. For example, the table is checked and there are no changes at that moment, but if you add a new row in the next 5-6 seconds while checking the other tables, then that change(new row) will be "forgotten" every subsequent synchronization.

body:
I have a table composed of only two columns that are the primary key. I noticed that  method "CreateStoredProcedures(DbConnection connection, DbTransaction transaction = null)" does not  create these procedures ... bulkupdate and ... update. Probably because these procedures do not exist when synchronizing this table, an exception occurs - "Dotmim.Sync.SyncException: 'Invalid index 0 for this SqlParameterCollection with Count = 0.'"

Procedures are not created due to the hasMutableColumns requirement

How can this case be solved?

title: [Critical] - BatchDirectory is serialized and sent to client
body:
When doing our first checks with dotmim.sync, we used a Xamarin.Android based client.
To our suprise, the agents ".Configuration.BatchDirectory" was set to the apps local folder (just as it should be, as it does not have write access anywhere else).
But during the sync process, we got some "UnauthorizedAccessExceptions" telling us that the temp folder of the server machine was inaccessible.

The reason is, that the SyncConfiguration.BatchDirectory is actually serialized and sent to the client.
So during the sync process, the agents batchdirectory is updated with the one from the server, which makes synchronization impossible.

Frankly, I do not see the reason why you would **ever** want to send the batchdirectory to the client. It is the same as sending the connectionstring to the client. Isn't it?

title: [Question] Large database dump
body:
Setup:
Server: WebProxyServerProvider
Client: Xamarin.Android app (SqliteSyncProvider)

I have a MySql database, which contains 200 000 records. The synchronization process between WebProxyServerProvider and SqliteSyncProvider takes up to 30 mins, maybe even more.

What I decided to do is to set up a daily scheduled background job to locally create a database "dump", which could then be downloaded normally and used on clients.

The question is: 
Is it okay to use the same .db file on multiple clients? I'm afraid there might be problems with the scope_info table.

title: [Enhancement] - Callback on client for Downloaded/Conflicting rows
body:
Think about this scenario:

* On the client side, you may have edited some customer data, which is still open in your view.
* During the sync, the customer record you just edited is rejected by the server (as some guy modified that employee first)
* So Dotmim.Sync sends back the server-record of the customer which is then used to update the clients database.

The problem is:
as there is no callback on the client side, that some conflicting records have been downloaded, we have to reload all user interfaces every time we synchronized with dotmim.sync.
Even if we do so, the user may not realize that all his/her changes have just been overruled by some other data.

=> it would be great to get some "Progress" callbacks on the client side, where the downloaded and (most importantly) conflicting records can be examined.
Then we could fire UI notifications and the like.

The same would be great on the server side where we could modify/accept/reject any records received by a client application.

What do you think?

title: [Question] - are insert/update/delete triggers executed on bulk-insert/update/delete?
body:
The old *Microsoft Sync Framework* used the bulk insert feature of SqlServer to speed up the sync process.
The downside was, that the insert/update/delete triggers on the tables were not executed.

It seems to me, that Dotmim.Sync uses another approach `MERGE` statements.

Am I right in the assumption, that the insert/update/delete triggers are executed no matter if the normal or bulk insert/update/delete stored procedures are used?
(`cause that would save me a lot of time...)

title: [Enhancement] - pull (MySQL/Sql)ObjectNames into core
body:
With regards to #91, we have the need to know the names that are created by dotmim sync for a given table and syncconfiguration.

What we see is, that the ...ObjectNames object exists for every database.
Moreover there is an internal static method in each DbBuilder `GetParsers` which returns the names of the table and the tracking table.

Question:
Wouldn't it be better to 
- include all names for a given `DmTable` in the `...ObjectNames` object.
- create that object once in the CoreProvider and pass it along to all builders
- and additionally provide a method, that is accessible to the `ISyncEventInterceptor`s, so that we can use it to provision additional stuff and be sure that we always have the correct names in use

What do you think?

title: [Enhancement] Provide simple versionability for sync scopes
body:
Hi @Mimetis!

The following suggestion is a bit based on the problems described in issue #86 - namely if we wanted to support a versioning of the `SyncConfiguration`.

With the *old sync framework* it was usually the case, that, once you had your sync context setup (with all tables etc.) you could not change those tables anymore - or at least only with huge effort.

The basic feature description is:

*Allow the application developer to specify a version on a sync context and once a client connects with a different version (or lower), it reinitializes but tries to upload any changes first*

There are some "simple" scenarios, however, where versioning support would be **awesome**:

**Scenario 1**
The maximum period that a client is allowed to stay disconnected to a sync scope is - by default - 14 days.
Now when already in production, we realize, that we need to extend that period to (e.g.) 3 months.
What should happen then, is that a client, which synchronzies again after 15+ days, gets the new period (3 months) through the sync configuration and thus decides to just continue synchronizing data incrementally. After a disconnection period of 3 months. however, it should synchronize as `ReinitializeWithUpload`.
Basically, this scenario would not require the application developer to raise the version of the `SyncConfiguration`, as the disconnection period should be transmitted anyways.

**Scenario 2**
We add another column to a table.
In that case, the application developer wants to make sure, that all clients will get that data, so she raises the version of the `SyncConfiguration` object to `2`.
Once a client with version `1` synchronizes again, it notices the raised version, and thus runs the sync process as `ReinitializeWithUpload`.
Of course, Dotmim.Sync would then need to be able to alter existing table definitions (only add columns - deletion or modification to a stricter mode (e.g. make a column non nullable) cannot be supported as it would break existing clients)

**Scenario 3**
We add another table to the scope.
In that case, the application developer wants to make sure, that all clients get that data, so again the version of the `SyncConfiguration` is raised to `3`
So once a client connects, which is running version 1 or version 2, it runs the sync process as `ReinitializeWithUpload`, and thus also gets the new table.

I guess these scenarios are the ones that we missed the most, when it comes to maintain an application that is using the microsoft sync framework.

Do you agree, that these scenarios should be doable and included?

Do you think we are missing something? (e.g. the scenario, that a table is removed from a sync scope completely?)

title: [Question] - when items are tombstoned on server, they are deleted on client but remain in _tracking table
body:
Hi!

Doing our integration tests, we noticed:
1) syncing rows from the server to a client
2) then deleting the rows from the server...
3) and syncing with the client again
=> actually removes the rows from the client (good), but keeps the corresponding rows in the _tracking table

Now our question is: Will they eventually be deleted by dotmim.sync, or will they be kept there forever?

title: Filter - only one sync filter per table supported?
body:
Hi!

In my sync scenario, I need to pass two filters to the select_changes stored procedure:
one denotes the tenant (tenantid), and one the current user (userId)

I noticed, that when I add the second column (userId) as filter, dotmim.sync does not create any tracking tables, procedures or whatever and just fails silently.

Now initially I was thinking that the problem is, that the second colum (userid) actually does not exist on the table, that it filters.

However, when I added the *userid* column to the table, just to try it out, still no tracking tables, procedures, ... were created by dotmim.sync

So what I guess is, that currently only one filter value is supported.
Is that correct?

Because if so, this is a major show stopper for us => we'd need to implement it.

title: Web client/server separately
body:
I've made some changes here, mainly for Linux compatibility. Initially I started working on this because we hit #63, and I thought that it was due to the `Web` assembly being too big. :-)

* if tests are run on non-Windows, then SQL Server for Linux can be used instead of LocalDB (previously tests simply failed)
  * to create this container in Docker: `docker run -e 'ACCEPT_EULA=Y' -e 'SA_PASSWORD=QWE123qwe' -e 'MSSQL_PID=Express' -p 1433:1433 -d microsoft/mssql-server-linux:latest`
* again on Linux, it's easy to test against MySQL if container is created in docker like this:
    * `docker run --name mysql -p 3306 -e 'MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD=azerty31$' -d mysql:latest --character-set-server=utf8mb4 --collation-server=utf8mb4_unicode_ci --lower-case-table-names=1`
    * we set `lower_case_table_names`, otherwise `MySqlSyncForeignKeysTests` fail due to case-sensitivity of identifiers, which are lower-cased by `Dotmim.Sync`

title: Filter stored procs not deleted by Deprovision command
body: When using the deprovision command I noticed that stored procedures for filters are not removed by the command CoreProvider.DeprovisionAsync(config, SyncProvision.StoredProcedures) but should be.

title: Filters not working when setup through web proxies
body:
Filters work when syncing databases directly but not when using the web proxies. See below for details and proposed fix.

### Setup
#### Server appSettings.json
```
  "Sync": {
    "ConnectionString": "Data Source=DESKTOP-BSIVU73;Initial Catalog=AdventureWorks;Trusted_Connection=True;MultipleActiveResultSets=true",
    "Filters": {
      "Address": "StateProvince"
    },
    "Tables": [
        "Address"
```

#### Client code
```
	var clientProvider = new SqliteSyncProvider(dbPath);
	var proxyClientProvider = new WebProxyClientProvider(new Uri(endPoint + "/sync"));
	var agent = new SyncAgent(clientProvider, proxyClientProvider);
	agent.Parameters.Add("Address", "StateProvince", "Texas");
```

### Testing
When I do a full (no db) or incremental sync I get the following error:
``` 
Dotmim.Sync.SyncException: Bad Request ---> System.Exception: Bad Request
   at Dotmim.Sync.Web.HttpRequestHandler.<ProcessRequest>d__25`1.MoveNext()
```

The exception was thrown from the server side in CoreProvider.GetChanges:
```
	EnumerateChangesInBatchesInternal
	...
	var parameter = context.Parameters.FirstOrDefault(p => p.ColumnName.Equals(filter.ColumnName, StringComparison.InvariantCultureIgnoreCase) && p.TableName.Equals(filter.TableName, StringComparison.InvariantCultureIgnoreCase));
```
because `Parameters(p => p.TableName)`  is `null` 

I tracked this down to property `SyncParameter.TableName`. It doesn't have a setter and therefore could not be deserialized by `WebProxyClientProvider`

### Fix
The fix is simply change `SyncParameter.TableName` property from: 
`public string TableName { get; }` 
to 
`public string TableName { get; set; }`

Looks like a simple typo. 

Regards,
Guy

title: [question] are multiple sync scopes supported?
body:
Hi!

In all the documentation, what I could find were samples of a sync process where you include one or more tables.

Is it also possible to sync two tables in a separate sync scope?
E.g.:
We have some table which contains all buildings of a company.
Then there is another table containing tasks for a particular user.

Now the scenario would be, that buildings need to be synchronized far less often (e.g. every day), while tasks need to be synchronized every 10 minutes.

In order to achieve that, we'd split the sync process into two separate ones, ans also provide two separate rest endpoints for the synchronization (e.g. /sync/buildungs and /sync/tasks)

Is that - will that ever by - supported?

title: [Enhancement] Keep assembly version at 1.0 and only raise assemblyfileversion
body:
Hello!

I just noticed, that e.g. with dotmim.sync.web, the default setting for versioning is still active. 
Meaning, whenever I create a new version of the nuget package, both, the **assembly version** and the **assembly file version** are raised.

Raising the assembly version lead to numerous problems in the past, especially in the context of strong names.

So I would suggest we keep the assembly version at 1.0 by default and only raise the assembly file version.
That way, the versioning stuff could be handled by nuget entirely (referencing specific minimum versions of packages)

What do you think?

title: [Enhancement] Use the same sample database for all systems: "chinook"
body:
Hi!
The samples and tests of dotmim.sync use different databases: Adventureworks, Contoso, etc.

- While for AdventureWorks there is a sql script to generate the database, this is missing from the others and it is kind of hard to find Contoso these days.
- Moreover, the sample databases only work for MSSQL, not MySql, PostgreSQL, etc.
- And there is another issue with the unittests: Some tests restore a database from a backup. However, the command uses the fixed path "C:\users\mimentis\......" which does not exist on every PC.

My proposal:
- [ ] Use the same sql sample database for all databases. I would suggest [**chinook**](https://github.com/lerocha/chinook-database)
- [ ] Provide the database with sql scripts, as they can be checked in and versioned correctly. Those sql scripts should then also be used in the integration tests

What do you think? 
I am happy to help you with implementing this, I just do not want to create a PR which is ignored because you disagree.

title: AspNet Web API 2 support
body:
Hello!
I modified the project "Dotmim.Sync.Web" so that it creates dlls for
*) netstandard2.0 and ASP.NET Core (as up until now)
*) net462 and Web API 2
I followed this approach: [Replace existing projects with a multi-targeted .NET Core project](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/core/porting/project-structure#replace-existing-projects-with-a-multi-targeted-net-core-project)
along with this [Sample](https://github.com/dotnet/samples/tree/master/framework/libraries/migrate-library-csproj/)

In order to create a nuget package, just use the "pack" command on the project as usual.

**Please do not merge yet - I am still testing.**

Thinks to keep in mind:
*) Deliberately dropped support for the SyncResultAttribute for Web APi 2. Reason: It could be created by deriving from ActionFilterAttribute, but DI support is a problem. It would require users to always use DI and, moreover, use a DI framework which supports property injection, as ctor injection is not possible with attributes in Web API 2.

title: Cannot sync association table with just PKs
body:
Hi @Mimetis, 

I get an exception when attempting to sync an association or join table that defines a many-to-many relationship between two other tables. DotMim.Sync expects the association table to contain at least one column that is not a PK. The problem is an association table typically contains just two PKs.

When I sync with the below setup I get exception:

`NotSupportedException("PostTag does not contains any columns, excepting primary keys.")` 

I could create a superfluous column in the association table to keep Dotmim.Sync happy but that would be bad. It would be better to permit just syncing of PK data without the requirement of at least one non PK column.  

Hope it is easy to fix.

Database setup in SSMS
```
CREATE DATABASE [PostTag]
GO

USE [PostTag]
GO

CREATE TABLE [dbo].[Posts](
	[PostId] [int] IDENTITY(1,1) NOT NULL,
	[Title] [nvarchar](max) NULL,
	CONSTRAINT [PK_Posts] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED ([PostId] ASC) ON [PRIMARY]
)
GO

CREATE TABLE [dbo].[Tags](
	[TagId] [int] IDENTITY(1,1) NOT NULL,
	[Text] [nvarchar](max) NULL,
        CONSTRAINT [PK_Tags] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED ([TagId] ASC) ON [PRIMARY]
)
GO

CREATE TABLE [dbo].[PostTag](
	[PostId] [int] NOT NULL,
	[TagId] [int] NOT NULL,
	CONSTRAINT [PK_PostTag] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED ([PostId] ASC, [TagId] ASC) ON [PRIMARY]
)
GO

USE [PostTag]
SET IDENTITY_INSERT [dbo].[Posts] ON 
INSERT [dbo].[Posts] ([PostId], [Title]) VALUES (1, N'Best Boutiques on the Eastside')
INSERT [dbo].[Posts] ([PostId], [Title]) VALUES (2, N'Avoiding over-priced Hipster joints')
INSERT [dbo].[Posts] ([PostId], [Title]) VALUES (3, N'Where to buy Mars Bars')
SET IDENTITY_INSERT [dbo].[Posts] OFF
SET IDENTITY_INSERT [dbo].[Tags] ON 
INSERT [dbo].[Tags] ([TagId], [Text]) VALUES (1, N'Golden')
INSERT [dbo].[Tags] ([TagId], [Text]) VALUES (2, N'Pineapple')
INSERT [dbo].[Tags] ([TagId], [Text]) VALUES (3, N'Girlscout')
INSERT [dbo].[Tags] ([TagId], [Text]) VALUES (4, N'Cookies')
SET IDENTITY_INSERT [dbo].[Tags] OFF
INSERT [dbo].[PostTag] ([PostId], [TagId]) VALUES (1, 1)
INSERT [dbo].[PostTag] ([PostId], [TagId]) VALUES (3, 1)
INSERT [dbo].[PostTag] ([PostId], [TagId]) VALUES (1, 2)
INSERT [dbo].[PostTag] ([PostId], [TagId]) VALUES (3, 2)
INSERT [dbo].[PostTag] ([PostId], [TagId]) VALUES (2, 3)
INSERT [dbo].[PostTag] ([PostId], [TagId]) VALUES (3, 3)
INSERT [dbo].[PostTag] ([PostId], [TagId]) VALUES (2, 4)
INSERT [dbo].[PostTag] ([PostId], [TagId]) VALUES (3, 4)
GO
```
See https://blog.oneunicorn.com/2017/09/25/many-to-many-relationships-in-ef-core-2-0-part-1-the-basics/ for a code first setup.

The exception is generated in CoreProvider.Schema.ValidateTableFromColumns here:
```
if (columnsNotPkeys <= 0)
    throw new NotSupportedException($"{dmTable.TableName} does not contains any columns, excepting primary keys.");
```

title: Synchronization Azure and SQLite - timeout
body:
Hello Sebastien,

I am trying to synchronize Azure SQL database and local SQLite database. Server database is containing data (around 80MB) and SQLite should be created during the process. I use SqlSyncProvider and SqliteSyncProvider.

It has problem with proper provisioning. In original setting it always ends by exception _"Execution Timeout Expired.  The timeout period elapsed prior to completion of the operation or the server is not responding."_ during the **DatabaseApplying** phase. Setting properties DownloadBatchSizeInKB, ConnectTimeout, LoadBalanceTimeout doesn't help.

Temporary solution is to delete data in bigger tables (over 1K of records), selectively execute provisioning on server tables, get back data and then synchronize. Is timeout properly set in library? Or there are other ways except ConnectTimeout, LoadBalanceTimeout? It seems, that problem is between library and connection objects.

Thank you, Ondrej

title: Subsequent changes not synced from server when batching enabled and more than one table configured
body:
I found an issue related to batching. Changes on the server are not synced to the client when `DownloadBatchSizeInKB` is non-zero . This occurs only after the initial sync to create a client db and only for more than one table. I am using an MSSQL on the server and Sqlite on the client. Steps to reproduce are:

* Setup the client console app
Dotmim.Sync\Samples\Dotmim.Sync.SampleConsole\Program.cs
```c#
/// <summary>
/// Test a client syncing through a web api
/// </summary>
private static async Task TestSyncThroughWebApi()
{
    // Sqlite Client provider for a Sql Server <=> Sqlite sync
    var clientProvider = new SqliteSyncProvider("c:/work/test.db");
    var proxyClientProvider = new WebProxyClientProvider(new Uri("http://localhost:54348/api/values"));

    var agent = new SyncAgent(clientProvider, proxyClientProvider);

    agent.SyncProgress += (s, a) => Console.WriteLine($"[Client] : {a.Message} {a.PropertiesMessage}");
    proxyClientProvider.SyncProgress += (s, a) => Console.WriteLine($"[Server] : {a.Message} {a.PropertiesMessage}");

    Console.WriteLine("Press a key to start (be sure web api is running...)");
    Console.ReadKey();
    do
    {
        Console.Clear();
        Console.WriteLine("Web sync start");
        try
        {
            var s = await agent.SynchronizeAsync(SyncType.Normal);
            Console.WriteLine(s);
        }
        catch (Exception e)
        {
            Console.WriteLine(e.Message);
        }

        Console.WriteLine("Sync Ended. Press a key to start again, or Escape to end");
    } while (Console.ReadKey().Key != ConsoleKey.Escape);

    Console.WriteLine("End");
}
```

title: Webfilter
body:
Hello,

I have create the filter attribute.

For the nuget your must add this depedency : Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Core

Use is simple, just add  [SyncResult] on controller or specific method. By default, all methods is trig (*), but you can define methods by : 
[SyncResult(OnMethods = new string[] { "POST" })]

Or simply with constructor :
[SyncResult("POST")]
[SyncResult("POST,DELETE")]

title: [Enhancement] Sync receipt
body:
We have the following scenario in our application:

1) an administrator creates tasks for several users
2) those tasks are to be synchronized to the users devices
3) the administrator wants to know, if the tasks have already been transmitted.

Would it be possible to add a "Transmitted" bit column onto the tracking tables?
This would need to be updated in the same transaction that selects the changes to transmit to the client during a sync session.
It seems to me that this would already do the trick on the server side.

As far as I understand, for each user/device dotmim.sync creates a new scopeid.
That scopeid then can be correlated (by application logic outside of the sync framework) to correlate a user and his/her device(s)

What do you think?

title: Handling constraint violations
body:
Hello!

I recently came up with multiple sync scenarios that cause me some headache.
In both cases, there might not be an actual sync conflict (by two users editing the same row), but constraint violations.

#Scenario 1:
We have a list of tasks in our system. Those tasks (somebody has to do something until the date xy) can be created via our web UI. But additionally, they can come from an external system which utilizes our REST API.
Now for those systems to identify their tasks, we provide a special column "reference" which is an arbitrary 120 character string. The only requirement is, that it is unique. 
We ensure this - obviously - using a database constraint.

However, now it can happen, that two users add a new task with the same value for "reference". So although both tasks have unique primary keys, there will be constraint violation error.

My question: Are there any sync tactics to overcome these problems? What would you do to solve this kind of problem with Dotmim.Sync?

#Scenario 2
Say you have some masterdata (list of equipments) that you store in a historized fashion.
Meaning: Each row identifying an equipment has a ValidFrom and ValidTo column.
Now whenever an equipment is modified, a new row is added to the table with [ValidFrom = getutcdate()] and validTo = infinity. And the "old" record is updated to [ValidTo = getutcdate()]

Now say you sync this table to your clients.

Both clients A and B update an existing equipment, thereby creating a new row each.
How would you solve this sync conflict?

I am really banging my head on this one...

title: Can client upload data when was not initialized from server?
body:
Hi!

I recently stumbled across a shortcoming of Microsoft Sync Framework again and wanted to know if this was fixed in doxmim sync.

With Sync Framework, you had to 
* locally provision the sync tables (in the client sqlite database)
* start an initial sync with the server
=> only then it was possible, to alter data in the client sqlite database and push those changes back to the server.

If you added data before the initial sync with the server, you'd get a "serverBlob is null" exception.

But sometimes, a user has some app, which is not yet connected to a server and (s)he adds data anyways. When online again, (s)he naturally wants to push those changes to the server nontheless.

Is this possible with dotmimsync, or do you still have to run an initial sync before editing data?

title: Use range to manage auto increment primary keys
body:
Hello Mimetis,
It would be better if we could provide a reference column from the table to be synced on which synchronization would work. For e.g. we are generating a unique column in addition to auto generated primary key in the table.
Let me explain the scenario why we need this;

Lets say we have three offline databases A, B and C which needs to be synchronized to a central database X.

When we add data to a table, it will auto generate data in primary key column. so offline databases A, B and C will generate their own data in a table and these data needs to union and stored in database X, which generates its own primary key data in the column.

So, when we sync the data from either A, B or C to database X, it overwrites the data on X with the same primary key. So Lets say there is a table City in all the databases and the first row in each database is as follows:
ID 1 in A: NYC
ID 1 in B: Sydney
ID 1 in C: Delhi

Now every time I sync the data from the last one to sync will overwrite the data at ID 1 in X.

What i need is
ID 1 in X: NYC
ID 2 in X: Sydney
ID 3 in X: Delhi

Kindly suggest a work around or the already implemented feature in your marvellous project.

Thanks,
Nischal

(

Hello Sebastien,
I have recorded a sample video to demonstrate the problem. In this video i use 3 MSSQL databases (DotminXAF as master and DotminXAF1, DotminXAF2 as slaves).
First I start the webserver of your samples that is slightly modified and then the client console, that syncs both slaves.
Now at first attempt the sync works fine, but when I modify the same field on both slaves, changes of first slave are synced to master, but second slave does not get the changes! Check out the video please.

[SyncBug.zip](https://github.com/Mimetis/Dotmim.Sync/files/1524626/SyncBug.zip)

title: [Question] Effects on EntityFramework Migrations
body:
Hi
Yesterday, I was working on a software based on SyncWinrt, and I remembered, that it has a quite significant issue:

It requires us to run SQL scripts at setup time, so the synchronization can actually work.
As we are using EntityFramework Code First, we had to include these scripts in the EF migrations.

That, however, had a quite negative impact: We could not use [Effort  ](https://github.com/tamasflamich/effort) - an in-memory provider for EF - anymore.
This significantly slowed down our test performance.

So my question:
What is the best way to use Dotmim.Sync in combination with EF Migrations? 
Did you think about this? :-)

title: MySqlParameter constructor is wrong with MySqlConnector implementation
[Proposal] Syncconflict - allow to merge changes
[Proposal] - Use schema as table prefix on client providers other than mssql
body:
Hi!

Seems you are making great progress here! It really looks awesome!
I went through the wiki, and saw the schema option:
https://github.com/Mimetis/Dotmim.Sync/wiki/04-Sql-Server-provider-:-Schema

I know a CMS called "Orchard" (Orchard Core is now the vnext in beta) which also supports a wide range of sql databases and requires something like a schema where it is not supported (mysql, sqlite, etc.)

Here, they simply use the schema name as prefix (e.g. with an underscore)

So in the example 
`agent.Configuration["Address"].Schema = "SalesLT";`


On sqlite thos could become something like
`SalesLT_Address`

This could also be configurable:
* enable/disable prefixes  (for compatibility reasons, I think the no brainer option would be to add these prefixes by default for all tables that do not belong to the [dbo] schema)
* [optionally] define how the prefix schould be calculated (Func<string, string>) so that I could:
   use another concatenator than underscore, or uppercase/lowercase the whole schemaname

This would be a nice addition :-)

title: [Proposal] Adding a command line tool to be able to sync quickly without coding
body:
# Proposition
the idea is to create a **CLI** (Command Line Interface) to be able to sync through a command line.
**Please post a comment to discuss what you think** :)

# CLI
The cli will be added as a package to the `dotnet` command.  
The command line **exe** will be called (by convention) :  `dotnet-sync.exe` to respect the naming convention from the `dotnet` runtime.  
Once installed, the command line will be then called like this : `dotnet sync [command] [--arguments]`  

## How it works
The CLI will create what we can call a **CLI Project**.
The **CLI Project** represents a sync processus beetween a server and a client.  
No sync process can be launched if no **CLI Project** is loaded (Actually, a default project is allways created when launching the CLI).  
Here is the most straightforward sample to launch a Sync process:
```
$ dotnet sync provider -p SqlSyncProvider -c "Data Source=(localdb)...." -s Server
Server provider of type SqlSyncProvider added.

$ dotnet sync provider -p SqliteSyncProvider -cs "adWorks.db" -s Client
Client provider of type SqliteSyncProvider added.

$ dotnet sync table --add ProductCategory, Product
Table ProductCategory added.

$ dotnet sync -s
Sync Start
Begin Session.
Ensure Scopes
Ensure Configuration
Configuration readed. 2 table(s) involved.
Selecting changes...
Changes selected : 12230
Applying changes...
Changes applied : 12230
Writing Scopes.
        436250e7-316e-45e5-ad9e-bae089e528ff synced at 06/11/2017 10:46:37.
        59a439cf-73e5-4cfb-8e19-092560554495 synced at 06/11/2017 10:46:37.
End Session.

```

Using a YAML file can be easier (see YAML section bellow)

```
$ dotnet sync yaml -f "projectsync.yml"
Loading yaml file
Project "projectsync01" loaded

$ dotnet sync -s
Sync Start
Begin Session.
Ensure Scopes
Ensure Configuration
Configuration readed. 2 table(s) involved.
Selecting changes...
Changes selected : 10
Applying changes...
Changes applied : 10
Writing Scopes.
        436250e7-316e-45e5-ad9e-bae089e528ff synced at 06/11/2017 10:46:37.
        59a439cf-73e5-4cfb-8e19-092560554495 synced at 06/11/2017 10:46:37.
End Session.
```

After a first sync, your last project is allways loaded when you launch the CLI.  
You can so directly launch the next sync process :  
```
$ dotnet sync -s
Sync Start
Begin Session.
Ensure Scopes
Ensure Configuration
Configuration readed. 2 table(s) involved.
Selecting changes...
Changes selected : 0
Applying changes...
Changes applied : 0
Writing Scopes.
        436250e7-316e-45e5-ad9e-bae089e528ff synced at 06/11/2017 10:46:37.
        59a439cf-73e5-4cfb-8e19-092560554495 synced at 06/11/2017 10:46:37.
End Session.
```


## CLI Project

The CLI will create a **CLI Project** stored in a datastore. Actually, a SQLite database is used to store CLI projects.
A CLI Project is mandatory to be able to launch a synchronization beetween two databases. When launching the CLI, a default project is loaded (called `__sync_default_project`).
A **CLI Project** can be represented by a yaml file to describe itself (see section on YAML bellow).  

A **CLI Project** is defined by :
* A project name.
* Two providers : One server and One client.
* At least one table defined by its name, schema (optional and only used on SQL Server) and direction (optional, default is `bidirectional`)
* A configuration defined with several key-value (as shown in the yaml sample below).

## Creating the CLI

**TODO** : How to install the CLI ? 

References :
* Adding the cli to `dotnet` command : [abusing dotnet core cli](https://surfingthecode.com/2017/02/abusing-dotnet-core-cli/)  
* `dotnet` extensibility model [https://docs.microsoft.com/fr-fr/dotnet/core/tools/extensibility]()
* Installing the `dotnet ef` CLI : [https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/ef/core/miscellaneous/cli/dotnet]() : Great, but require a `.csproj` file.

## CLI Commands

### Integration within dotnet command line

Since we are called from the `dotnet` command, and to be compliant with the `dotnet` command extensibility, each command will begin like this : 
```
$ dotnet sync [command] [--arguments]
```
Some useful requests don't need [command] and are called directly with their [arguments]

* `-v` or `--verion` : Get the current CLI & Dotmim.Sync version. 
* `-h` or `--help` : Get the help informations.
* `-s` or `--sync` : Launch the sync process on the actual loaded project. 
* `--verbose` : Enable verbose output.

### Create, Get, Delete CLI Project

All project commands are called prefixed with [command] `project`.  
The `project` command is the default command, you can ommit it .  
Every sync process is associated with a project. When you launch for the first time the CLI, a **default** project is created (called `__sync_default_project`).  


Arguments available within the `project` command :
* `-n` or `--new` : Creating a new project with a unique name.
* `-l` or `--load` : Load an existing project by its unique name.
* `-d` or `--delete` : Delete an existing project by its unique name.
* `-ls` or `--list` : List all projects created and saved within CLI.


Creating a **CLI project** called "**syncproject01**" : 
```
$ dotnet sync project -n "syncproject01"

Creating new project "syncproject01"
Project "syncproject01" loaded
```

Getting an existing **CLI Project** :
```
$ dotnet sync project -l "syncproject01"

Project "syncproject01" loaded
```

Deleting an existing **CLI Project** :
```
$ dotnet sync project -d "syncproject01"

Project "syncproject01" deleted
```


### Adding Sync providers

Once you have loaded your **CLI project**, you can add providers.
You must add one server and one client provider.
  
All providers commands are available through the [command] `provider` : 
```
$ dotnet sync provider [arguments]
```

Arguments available :
* `-p` or `--providerType` : Adding a provider type, like `SqlSyncProvider` or `SqliteSyncProvider` or `MySqlSyncProvider`.
* `-c` or `--connectionString` : Adding the provider connection string.
* `-s` or `--syncType` : Adding the provider sync type : could be `Server` or `Client`

Adding providers of type `SqlSyncProvider` as server side and `SqliteSyncProvider` as client side :  
```
$ dotnet sync provider -p SqlSyncProvider -c "Data Source=(localdb)...." -s Server;

Server provider of type SqlSyncProvider added to project syncproject01

$ dotnet sync provider -p SqliteSyncProvider -cs "adWorks.db" -s Client;

Client provider of type SqliteSyncProvider added to project syncproject01
 
```

Calling the the `dotnet sync provider` again will replace the current provider : 
```
$ dotnet sync provider -p MySqlSyncProvider -c "...." -s Server;

Server provider of type MySqlSyncProvider replaced in the project syncproject01
```

### Adding Sync tables

One you have loaded your **CLI Project**, you can add tables.
At least one table is mandatory to be able to launch the sync processus
All tables commands are available through the [command] `table` :
```
$ dotnet sync table [arguments]
```

Arguments availables:
* `-a` or `--add` : Adding a table identified with its name.
* `-s` or `--schema` : Set the schema name for the current table. Only used with the `SqlSyncProvider`.
* `-r` or `--remove` : Remove the specfied table from the sync process.
* `-d` or `--direction` : Set the sync direction for the current table. Could be `Bidirectional`, `UploadOnly` or `DownloadOnly`

Adding tables to the current project :  
```
$ dotnet sync table --add ProductCategory
Table ProductCategory added to the project syncproject01

$ dotnet sync table -a Product -d downloadonly
Table Product [DownloadOnly] added to the project syncproject01

$ dotnet sync table -a Employee -d downloadonly -s Sales
Table Sales.Employee [DownloadOnly] added to the project syncproject01

```

### Adding configuration options

You can specify several options for your current **CLI Project** through the configuation command.  
All configuration options are available through the [command] `conf` :
```
$ dotnet sync conf [arguments]
```

Arguments availables:

* `-c` or `--conflict` : can be  `ServerWins` or `ClientWins`. Default is `ServerWins`.
* `-s` or `--batchSize` : set the batch size. Default is 1000.
* `-d` or `--batchDirectory` : Set the batch directory. Default is your environment temp folder.
* `-f` or `--format` : Set the serialization format. Can be `json` or `dm`. Default is `json`
* `-o` or `--bulkOperations` : Set if you want to use bulk operations when using the `SqlSyncProvider` is used. Default is `true`.

Adding configuration to the current loaded **CLI Project**:
```
$ dotnet sync conf -c ClientWins -f dm -o true
```

# YAML Format

Working with a yml file could be easier.
All YAML options are available through the [command] `yaml` :
```
$ dotnet sync yaml [arguments]
```

Arguments availables:

* `-f` or `--file`: Set the file name to load. if not set, the default directory is used.
* `-d` or `--directory` : Set the directory where the YAML file is stored.

Loaded a **CLI Project** stored in a YAML file :
```
$ dotnet sync yaml -f "projectsync.yml"
```

## YAML File sample

Example of what we can have in such way :  
```
project: projectsync01

providers:
	- providerType:	SqlSyncProvider
	  connectionString : "Data Source=(localdb)\MSSQLLocalDB; Initial Catalog=AdventureWorks;Integrated Security=true;"
	  syncType: Server	
	
	- providerType:	SqliteSyncProvider
	  connectionString : "adWorks.db"
	  syncType: Client	
	
tables: 
	- name : ProductCategory
	  schema : dbo
	  syncDirection : bidirectional

	- name : Product
	  schema : dbo
	  syncDirection : bidirectional

configuration:
	- conflictResolution : ServerWins
	- downloadBatchSizeInKB : 1000
	- batchDirectory : "C:\\tmp"
	- serializationFormat : json
	- useBulkOperations : true

```

## YAML for .NET Core parser

Available on github :  [https://github.com/aaubry/YamlDotNet](https://github.com/aaubry/YamlDotNet)

title: Dotmim.Sync Turkish character error

When I examine the source code, the **InsertOrUpdateScopeInfo(ScopeInfo scopeInfo)** method in **...ScopeInfoBuilder.cs** has `scopeInfo.Id = (Guid) reader ["sync_scope_Id"]; ` The line I casts an error because the characters I and i are different characters as the big typed Turkish Character.

title: Client and Server schema must be the same
body:
Hello!

I was wondering, how you are planning to solve the problem, that client and server schemas are not always quite the same.

For example: In our production system, we have a tasks table.
This table looks different on the server and client. I.e. server and client table share a set of columns, but both, server and client, add additional columns to their own tasks tables.

This also leads me to the following question:
Are you planning to solve the problem of the old sync framework which is, that those schemas must be equal and must not ever change?
(e.g. a schema update would be necessary)

You could:
1) add an (optional) middle layer between client and server that can process all rows and convert them from one schema to another. That way you could allow downward compatibility in case the server schema changes.

2) please have a look at this library, as I think it could save you a to of work: [DatabaseSchemaReader](https://github.com/martinjw/dbschemareader)


Not only allows it to inspect the schema of all databases you want to support, it even allows to create schema-migration sql and the like.
So - very powerful stuff here.

Also, it runs on .NET Core.

title: Ideas and Feature Requests
body:
Hi!

I have had a look at Dotmim.Sync, and compared its current capabilities with the stuff, that we currently have in production. (we are using [SyncWinRT](https://github.com/Mimetis/SyncWinRT) - I guess you know that library ;-))

What we definitively need is:

**1) a way to specify a filter on a table that is being synced.**  
Currently, when a filter is active, the Microsoft Syncframework regards all filtered records as "out of the sync scope". However, when the rows change in a way that should re-include them to that sync scope, the old Syncframework was not able to detect this.
We made that possible by updating the "_tracking" tables manually, using our server side logic.

**1b) we even need to be able to filter based on a table join!**
We currently achieve that by modifying the sql scripts (stored procedures) which are generated by the framework, so that they add a join expression. The complexity in that approac is, that the join filter also needs to take into account, that the joined table might have changes as well. (so while the current row should have not been synced to the client, it now should based on some changes in the joined table)
The only part where it got too complicated was with many-to-many joins. (I might be able to assist you with that feature ;-))

**2) Another part that was kinda cumbersome is, that SyncWinRT identified the sync master by its fully qualified domain name.**
That was a problem when users hat to use a different URL when they were in their corporate network. 
A quite easy fix would be, that the master database generates some guid, which is in turn used to identify it. In that case, the URL does not matter anymore.

**3) allow to change serialization format**
I have been playing around with protobuf-net recently and I am amazed by its performance. 
As it normally uses reflection just as any other formatter, it also allows you compile a dll with a "hard-coded" serializer. Dude that one is sooooo fast!!!
So I would really like to use that insead of json or the like. (Again: I could help you with that)

**4) Support one-way sync.**
That one is interesting, because we are thinking about syncinc an Event Stream (neventstore) from server to client, thereby applying some filters (as in (1) and (1b))
However, as the event stream **must** only be edited on the server, there is no need for two-way syncing.
So a one-way sync option for a specific table would be great!

**5) Use dotmim.sync for a file syncing api**
A colleague of me created a github library, that allows you to split up your binary files into aprts, send them to a Web-API server, and fuse them back together.
That allows you to send large files over weak internet connections.
Now it would be great to have that combined with dotmim sync as a file sync framework:
That way, on the client side you know which files are already uploaded, and which are pending.
You can also send the list of files a client requires (using sync) and let him/her decide which files to actually download.
Sure, this is far beyond the scope of Dotmim.Sync, but I wanted to share this idea with you nevertheless, as you might have some interesting ideas for it too. ;-)


So what do you think about my ideas and feature requests?

title: Security Vulnerability with Chutzpah using Lodash 4.17.15
body:
Security Vulnerability of Command Injection CVE-2021-23337 with Lodash. Chutzpah is still using 4.17.15 Lodash version. 

All versions of package lodash; all versions of package org.fujion.webjars:lodash are vulnerable to Command Injection via template.
https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-LODASH-1040724

Vulnerability is fixed by Lodash with the new version 4,17,21 , 
https://github.com/lodash/lodash/issues/5083

can Chutzpah be updated with the same?

title: Running Chutzpah on macOS from within VS Code?
body: I've installed the Chutzpah Runner in VS Code on macOS, but I'm not sure how to tell it where the .exe lives -- or, more to the point, how to get a living .exe on my macOS box. The settings seem to suggest Chutzpah is compatible with *NIX when it says `~/ChromeDevSession` may be used for the profile folder by default, but I wasn't able to figure out how to [install the nuget](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Chutzpah). In my case, I'm just trying to edit the client-side code for an app with no csproj file. It doesn't look like (understandably) that nuget is happy with this situation -- that is, nuget seems to expect a csproj host [or equivalent]. ``` projects/QuestionBuilder.Client $ dotnet add package Chutzpah --version 4.4.10 Could not find any project in `/Applications/projects/QuestionBuilder.Client/`. ``` Does Chutzpah run on macOS/Core? How would I install a copy to run outside of a csproj environment? **NOTE:** Also posted on [the Chutzpah Runner repo](https://github.com/dfrencham/vscode-chutzpahrunner/issues/22) in case that's more appropriate.

body:
Hello,

title: No way to define custom test harness for context menu extension
body:
The core of our issue that we are facing is that we want to turn off jasmine running tests in random order. This is not a problem when running from the command line because we can specify our own custom test harness, but the extension uses it's own version of the test harness tucked away in the install location of the extension.

As a result it is not possible to configure the test harness used by the context menu, such as run in browser.

It would be great if we can configure which test harness to use when using any of the context menu options.

title: When using Server Mode debug in Test Explorer does not work
body:
# Summary
Debugging from the Test Explorer with Server mode turned on almost always fails. It looks like the test harness is completing and the web server (setup by Chutzpah) is being closed BEFORE Visual Studio has time to get in and launch and connect to a browser.

Running debug from the Context Menu "Run Chutzpah with Debugger" works just fine in the exact same code base and configuration.

I'm guessing this is about how the lifecycle of the Web Server is controlled but I would naturally expect the two ways of debugging to work in the same way (and the following would appear to agree: https://github.com/mmanela/chutzpah/wiki/Debugging-Unit-Tests).

# Details
Basic steps in any VS solution where Server Mode is enabled (explicitly or implicitly through the use of Chrome of JsDom engines):

Repo: https://github.com/john-swallow-cenduit/ChutzpahDebugIssue

- Build the solution so that Chutzpah picks up the single test.
- Put a breakpoint in the test.
- Locate the test in test explorer. 
- Run Debug and wait.

Expected: Browser starts. Jasmine page is loaded. Breakpoint is hit.
Actual: Most of the time it will launch an IE window and throw up a "Cannot reach this page" error.

Full details of all versions used are in the readme.md of the repo but the Chutzpah versions in use:
- Chutzpah 4.4.10
- Chutzpah Context Menu 4.4.9
- Chutzpah Test Adapter for Visual Studio 2012 4.4.9

I've included a bunch more observations in the readme.md in the repo but I have attempted to draw out just the pertinent ones here for the sake of brevity.

title: chutzpah.console.exe exits with code 2 instead of timeout
body:
When the execution duration of a test file exceeds the timeout the chutzpah.console.exe terminates with 'exit code 2':

```
Error: Unknown error occurred when executing test file. Received exit code of 2
```

The intended error message should be

```
Error: Timeout occurred when executing test file
```

Engine is set to Chrome. 

I managed to track this issue down and file a [pull request](https://github.com/mmanela/chutzpah/pull/780).

title: Move 'browser' variable to outer scope
body:
The browser variable is declared in the inner scope of a try-catch block.

There are [references](https://github.com/mmanela/chutzpah/blob/6fb2df4ec43000dfcf51808c71383e11b0cec585/Chutzpah/ChutzpahJSRunners/Chrome/chutzpahRunner.js#L342) to this variable outside that block which may lead to a 'variable not defined'.

This leads to an issue when the execution of a test file exceeds the configured timeout. In this case the chutpah.console.exe will terminate with a generic 'exit code 2' from the [general error handler in the qunitRunner.js component](https://github.com/mmanela/chutzpah/blob/6fb2df4ec43000dfcf51808c71383e11b0cec585/Chutzpah/ChutzpahJSRunners/Chrome/qunitRunner.js#L21) instead of the intended timeout error.

title: Https-agent-proxy is vulnerable
body:
Hello!
The chutzpah uses some vulnerable https-agent-proxy package start from the 4.4.0 version. After some investigation, I have noticed that this package is used by other npm packages like "puppeteer" and "puppeteer-core"(chutzpah\Chutzpah\Node\packages and chutzpah\EdgeJsPackages). 
Please update the versions of these packages to make the chutzpah safe for using in projects. 

Thanks a lot)

title: AMD, Chutzpah, typescript. Chutzpah test explorer not detecting jasmine tests with import statement in it.
Upgrade to Jasmine 3.3
body:
Hello, is it possible to upgrade the included version of Jasmine to v3.3 (at least, latest is v3.5)? 

This is to enable usage of [.withContext](https://jasmine.github.io/api/edge/matchers.html#withContext) feature that provides explanations on failed matchers.

title: Disable CORS by default
body: Disable CORS by default in Chrome runner to enable running tests in Headless Chrome which utilize AJAX requests. This is consistent to the behavior when running tests with PhantomJS as target engine.

title: Set Arguments for Headless Chrome
body: Since PhantomJS doesn't support ES6 features, I switched to Headless Chrome as testing engine. Since my tests are using AJAX requests, I need to disable CORS using the flag `--disable-web-security`. Unfortunately, the arguments defined in `BrowserArguments` are only passed when using the `/openInBrowser` switch and seem to be completely ignored for headless browsers. I think it would be useful if you could define arguments for headless browers as well, e.g. using the key `HeadlessChrome` or `JSDom` within `BrowserArguments`. An alternative would be to add a property like `Arguments` to the `EngineOptions` setting and pass them to the specified engine.

title: FIPS compliance
body:
- Changed `SHA1Managed` to `HMACSHA1` in Hasher.cs
- Updated Xunit and ServiceStack.Text to their FIPS compliant versions (this resulted in quite a few transitive dependencies updating as well)
- Updated default.ps1 to point to the new xunit.console.exe location.

These two fix the CS1762 compiler warning: 
- EnvDte.Constants can't be embedded, so I created DTEConstants.cs and manually added the constants that were being referenced.
-  `EnvDte.SolutionClass` needed to be changed to its interface, `EnvDte.Solution`, to compile.

title: Chutzpah tests trigger an endless discovery loop with CPS projects
body:
Filed from [this](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/639406/chutzpah-tests-added-to-projects-based-on-the-new.html) feedback issue. 

**Environment:** VS 2019 update 2 preview bits.

**Repro Steps:**
1. Create a new .Net Core Console application.
2. Add a .js file to the project.
3. Update its content to be the below:
```
function isEven(val) { 
    return val % 2 === 0; 
} 
  
test('TestMethodPass', function () {    
    ok(isEven(2), 'Two is an even number');    
    ok(!isEven(1), 'One is not an even number');         
}) 
  
test('TestMethodFail', function () {    
    ok(isEven(3));         
}) 
```
4. Open Test Explorer.

**Expected:**
2 tests are discovered.

**Observed:**
The test explorer does discover 2 tests but it endlessly performs discovery operations on the js file.

**Note:**
This is tied to the project being updated because of the temporary html file created during Chutzpah test discovery. This triggers a container changed event as part of every discovery which in turn triggers another discovery. 

**Workaround:**
Change the location of the temporary html file as stated in the linked feedback.

title: Add option to inspect node process.
body:
A corresponding update should be made to the wiki to document the new option EngineOptions.NodeInspect.

When NodeInspect is true, the first argument to the node.exe process will be `--inspect-brk`, which allows a remote debugger to connect to localhost:9229. Furthermore, the debugger will break at the first line of execution, meaning the test will not proceed until the user has opened the debugger and continued the script.

The easiest way to do this is open Chrome and go to about:inspect. Once the node.exe process is started, there will be a Remote Target listed, similar to this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/397836/56671045-e462b800-6681-11e9-8a58-168475191563.png)

Just click Inspect to open the debugger.

Maybe: disable the TestFileTimeout when this option is used?

title: any suggestions on how to use esnext typescript modules with Chutzpah
body:
I have been using Chutzpah for a couple of years now and it has been great. The entire time we have been writing Typescript code and testing wth jasmine.

Chutzpah happily worked when we defined everything in namespaces instead of modules and it survived when we moved to requireJS and started created real modules and importing modules. Then it survived our switch from requireJS to webpack. Chutzpah happily continued using requireJS and it now used the JS files that were created each time we saved the TS file to disk, where webpack would do its own compilation and keep it's version in memory (or some other cache). 

But Chutzpah isn't fairing so well with the next move. I need to start using dynamic import statements. TS and webpack happily work together to build bundles that can be loaded dynamically at run time. But that means that I had to switch TS options from module: amd to module: esnext. 

The end result is that the TS files that are saved to disk no longer have the required "define" call that makes them compatible with RequireJS. So no code is imported and no tests are found. 

I am wondering if anybody has run into this situation and figured out a work around. 

I am considering having Chutzpah be responsible for compiling the TS code. This entire time, I have had Chutzpah setup to assume there is some external entity that is compiling the code. 

I am also going to look to see if there is an option in webpack for overriding the options in the ts options file. I didn't think about that until I started writing up this issue. That might be the best way to go. But if anybody has come up with a solution already, that would be great. 

Thanks
Greg

title: Race condition causing intermittent errors with Jasmine/Chrome/AMD
body:
When using Jasmine, the Chrome engine and AMD modules, I encounter a few issues once in a while:
- ChutzpahJasmineReporter.specDone throws an error because activeTestCase is undefined
- Chutzpah gets stuck evaluating isTestingDone over and over

It happens much more frequently with SystemJS, though it does happen very occasionally with RequireJS.

I digged deeper and found that the issues happen when ChutzpahJasmineReporter gets registered after initializeJasmine is called.

chutzpah.autoStart is always true so the test harness file automatically calls initializeJasmine after importing the test file. Since the evaluation of onFrameworkLoaded in chutzpahRunner.js is async, there's no guarantee that it is run before initializeJasmine is called.

Maybe some synchronization code needs to be introduced?

title: Fix issue #602 wrong number of tests displayed by TeamCity
body:
The issue is caused by running tests in parallel without setting the flowId's of messages in TeamCity's output.

Running tests in parallel can easily cause messages from different threads to be interleaved on the output, which TeamCity can't handle without the use of flowIds.

This PR adds flowIds to TeamCity outputs. This is implemented by introducing a ```TaskId``` property on ```TestContext``` and passing it to ```ITestMethodRunnerCallback``` methods, which output the ```TaskId``` as the ```flowId``` in each message.
Two new methods are also needed on the ```ITestMethodRunnerCallback``` interface: ```TestContextStarted``` => flowStarted, ```TestContextFinished``` => flowFinished in order to notify TeamCity about the flows.
