title: error loading source script when running chutzpah with code coverage and jasmine
body:
I am having the same issue mentioned in ticket https://github.com/mmanela/chutzpah/issues/340, now closed, where I encounter an error loading source files with code coverage enabled.

I have the latest version of the Chutzpah VSIX installed on my TFS 2015 server in VS 2015 Enterprise. Every time the server does a CI build I get this error. It was an internment issue until today when it became such a problem only 1 in 20 builds was passing. Yet all local test runs on developer machines always pass.

I did some digging and found that the error is caused by the fact that there is a default 180 ms timeout as per _blanket.options("timeout") when loading source files in the attachScript method ( line 5141 ) of the blanket_jasmine_v2.js file.
I hard coded this value to 10000 ms and my problem is solved, all TFS CI test runs are green again.

Can you please provide documentation on how to override this value in the chutzpah.json configuration? And adjust the default passed into blanket when enabling code coverage to a more sensible value like 3000 or 5000 ms. I imagine anyone with a large number of test on a busy server will be impacted by this problem.

title: Tests duplicated within Test Explorer Window
body:
This is my project structure in VS:

```
|- src/
  |- srcFile1.ts
  |- srcFile2.ts
|- Chutzpah.json
|- tests/
  |- testFile1.ts
  |- testFile2.ts
  |- testFile3.ts
```

Currently testFile1.ts contains testA and testB, while testFile2.ts contains testC and testD, so 4 tests in total, but the Test Explorer window is showing 12 tests.

The testA appears 3 time with the sources: testFile1.ts, testFile2.ts, testFile3.ts;
the same for testB, testC, and testD.

I want to see the testA only 1 time (the one with the source testFile1.ts), how can I achieve this?

My Chutzpah.json file is like that:

```
{
    "Framework": "jasmine",
    "References": [
         { "Path": "test/", "Includes": [ "*.js" ] }
    ],
    "Tests": [
        { "Path": "test", "Excludes": [ "*.js" ] }
    ]
}
```

title: Guidance for dnx based projects
body:
Firstly, thanks for making Chutzpah.

Unfortunately, I have spent a long time trying to get Chutzpah to work for my project, and have failed! 

I am using VS2015
My project is a new Dnx based project, targeting dnx451.

I am assuming the reason I am struggling is because this sort of setup is either unsupported or not yet fully tested / documented yet.

Firstly, adding the Chutzpah NuGet package didn't appear to do anything for me. I added it to the project.json file, it seemingly installs,  but then I can't find anything in the packages directory, no chutzpah console exe etc.

So I moved on to using the test adaptor which to be honest is my preferred way of running tests anyway.

My existing project looks like this:
- Project A 
  - wwwroot
    - lib
      - (bower dependencies installed here)
    - modules
      - (compiled typescript output here as AMD modules)
    - require.config.js
  - typings
    - (tsd's installed here) 
  - Scripts
    - tsconfig.json (typescript project settings file)
    - typescriptOne.ts
    - typescriptTwo.ts

I like to keep my tests in a seperate project, so I created a new project to contain the tests for the above project, i.e:
- Project A 
- Project A.Tests

The tests projects adheres to the same structure as the first.

Try as I might, I couldn't get the test adaptor to work, and I am sure it must be something to with my Chutzpah settings file.

Each time it tried to discover my tests it hit problems which were shown in the output window. For example:

```
------ Discover test started ------
Error: Timeout occurred when executing test file
While Running:e:\src\projectA\wwwroot\test2.js

```

The problem for me is, the output isn't helpful to me in identifying whats wrong. I have been tweaking the Chutzpah file, and each time it would usually lead to a different exception in the output window. Sadly, because the test harness html file is deleted by the test adaptor each time, I can't easily see what impact my tweaks to the chutzpah config file is making to the test harness. I also can't open the test harness html file manually to try and see what the problem is and why thye test adaptor might be reporting an exception - because it only exists for a very short period of time on disk.

I've decided that for now, I can't afford to waste anymore time figuring out what is wrong, but if there are any brave souls out there that can demonstrate some sample, showing Chutzpah being used in a new Dnx project, AND testing typescript files that live in a seperate project, I'd find that really really helpful.

title: How to tell Chutpah the order of the files / Reduce reference maintenance
body:
Hi,
I have an issue when writing with TypeScript and using a base class - the base class file might get referenced after the derived which makes the derived class to not be initialized.
assuming I have a folder called `parsers` with typescript files I tried the following in the `chutzpah.json` file but it didn't work:

``` json
{ "Path": "isrealhiking.web\\services\\parsers\\", "Includes": ["Base1.ts", "Base2.ts"]},
{ "Path": "isrealhiking.web\\services\\parsers\\", "Includes": ["*.ts"]},
```

but they were still referenced alphabetically.
the following did work but the json file starts to look bad and the maintenance for this is high.

``` json
{ "Path": "isrealhiking.web\\services\\parsers\\Base1.ts"}
{ "Path": "isrealhiking.web\\services\\parsers\\Base2.ts"}
{ "Path": "isrealhiking.web\\services\\parsers\\", "Includes": ["*.ts"]},
```

Is there a better way to reference all the files I need in order to test my code?
I'm already doing it in the index.html file, is there a way to take it from there?

title: IO error when saving a file in VS
Object reference not set to an instance of an object. at Chutzpah.TestHarness.BuildTags(IEnumerable`1 referencedFilePaths)
body:
I am posting the issue I encountered here as a reference for anyone trying to setup Chutzpah as a part of a TFS build configuration. The error i encountered was:

Error: System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object. 
at Chutzpah.TestHarness.BuildTags(IEnumerable`1 referencedFilePaths) 
at Chutzpah.TestHarnessBuilder.CreateTestHarness(TestContext testContext, TestOptions options) 
at Chutzpah.TestRunner.<>c__DisplayClass15.<ExecuteTestContexts>b__14(TestContext testContext) 
While Running:C:\Builds\1\appname\Main_Compile+UnitTest\bin_PublishedWebsites\WebClient\test\unit\formattingServiceTest.js 

The problem was caused by missing references. Here is a excerpt from my test file:

  `describe('Authentication Service Tests', function ()`
  `{`
    `beforeEach(function()`
   `{`
        `module('appname.enums');`
       `module('appname.constants');`
      `module('appname.services');`
    `});`

```
it('Given user with no roles HasRoleLRR returns false', inject([
    'AuthenticationService', function (authenticationService) {
        var testUser = {
            id: 1,
            identityKey: 'test.user',
            label: 'test user',
            roles: []
        };

        expect(authenticationService.getRoleInfo(testUser).hasRoleLRR).toBeFalsy();
    }
]));`
```

Once i added references to the top of the file, everything was ok:

 `/// <reference path="../../app/components/angular/angular.js" />`
 `/// <reference path="../../app/components/angular-mocks/angular-mocks.js" />`
 `/// <reference path="../../app/components/underscore/underscore.js" />`
 `/// <reference path="../../app/scripts/modules.js" />`
 `/// <reference path="../../app/scripts/config/config.js" />`
 `/// <reference path="../../app/scripts/config/enums.js" />`
 `/// <reference path="../../app/scripts/factory/authenticationService.js" />`

Thanks,
Ognjen

title: Putting a Path in references for my TypeScript files to test breaks Chutzpah
ko is not defined Error in Chutzpah with Knockout Using Require Js
TypeScipt Javascript dependencies not being picked up in Chutzpah 4.2.0
body:
This relates to [the StackOverflow question over here](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/35437408/chutzpah-angularjs-testing-with-jasmine-and-typescript). Logging here so to provide a Code Repo of the issue. [ChutzpahRepo1.zip](https://github.com/mmanela/chutzpah/files/136055/ChutzpahRepo1.zip)

I am using Angular 1.4.9 with Jasmine 2.2.0 and Chutzpah 4.2.0 with both my Angular code and unit tests in TypeScript in Visual Studio 2015 Update 1.

It appears that Chutzpah is not respecting reference javascript include in the Chutzpah.json file (namely angular in this case). When I run the tests via Chutzpah (context or VS test integration) the error states "can't find variable: Angular" and "can't find variable inject". 

Running the test cases with Resharper (after some messing with the project structure as R# has it's own issues) results in the angular framework dependency being loaded and the correct angular error being thrown back (the controller is not known to Angular so to prove that angular is indeed loaded).

title: Chutzpah showing too many tests
body:
Hi,
So I ended up working on Chutzpah tests in work that hadn't been working locally. They worked on tfs but not outside of it. So I adapted the code to read reference comments.

```
       "Tests": [
    { "Include": "*.js", "ExpandReferenceComments": "true" }
     ]
```

However, now if you run the tests individually, it'll show the correct amount of tests per file. However if you run them all. It'll show far more tests than there actually are. Any thoughts on how to resolve this?

title: Fix typescript reference issue
body:
Given C:\path\to\src\chutzpah.json
And the command C:\path\to\src>ctz chutzpah.json

```
{
  ... other options removed for brevity ...
  "Compile": {
    "UseSourceMaps": true,
    "Mode": "External",
    "Extensions": [ ".ts" ],
    "ExtensionsWithNoOutput": [ ".d.ts" ]
  },
  "References": [
    { "Path": "tests/mocks.ts" },
    { "Path": "../../other-src/code.ts" }
  ]
}
```

I want the chutzpah to build the following references in the harness:

```
<script href="file:///C:/path/to/src/tests/mocks.js"></script>
<script href="file:///C:/path/other-src/code.ts"></script>
```

At present it omits the second Reference as its absolute path does not
start with the directory path of the chutzpah.json file
(BatchCompilerService : line 182)

P.S. I would have written tests against this case, but I couldnt install
the xUnit test runner. The VISX installer crashed.

title: Is there any way to make ReSharper-like file reference comment syntax (~/ for current project dir) work in Chutzpah?
Abort test execution if the Chutzpah.json file is malformed
body:
This PR provides a fix for issue #462. When parsing a malformed Chutzpah.json file, it will throw an exception and abort test execution. It will show a message similar to the following:

`Chutzpah.Exceptions.ChutzpahException: Error parsing Chutzpah.json: After parsing a value an unexpected character was encountered: {. Path 'References[0]', line 9, position 9.`

title: Added Emma XML coverage transformer + Unit tests
body:
This PR attempts to solve issue #403 by using the Emma XML format (schema example [here](http://emma.sourceforge.net/coverage_sample_c/coverage.xml)).

The new transformer has 100% coverage.

I tested this in a local installation of Jenkins (version 1.646, Emma version 1.29) for a project of mine and got the following output:

![jenkins](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5374887/12700231/76933904-c7b9-11e5-957e-1691ba168da0.png)

The fact that the results are placed in the "method" column seems to be an issue with Emma. The numeric values actually correspond to the "line" column.

I don't think Chutzpah distinguishes between packages, classes and files; therefore, I'm not considering per-package or per-class coverage, only per-file coverage. Let me know whether you'd like me to consider a folder a "package".

title: Reset the referenced template before running each test
body:
Is it possible to update/reset the DOM as it was before running the test. The problem I am having is that in some of my tests, I update few DOM elements but in my other tests (which are in the same file) I am expecting it to be at initial state which is before I ran my first test. Let me give me an example to explain it better

Added a template reference
`/// <template path="Index.html" />`

which will be loaded before running any tests. fine.

now in one of my tests, I updated the DOM (e.g. added some data attributes)

now when I run my second test, It is not expecting that data attributes but it found it because of earlier test.

Now the question is that is it possible to reset the content of loaded template?

title: When using a malformed Chutzpah.json config file, the test runner should immediately die and give a message indicating such.
Chutzpah should run tests off of a localhost server instead of the file:// protocol
body:
Chutzpah-generated test harnesses currently use the `file://` protocol.

The biggest issue currently is that this breaks `XmlHttpRequest`. However, it also breaks quite a few other things. Almost everything that involves same-origin policies: `@font-face` web fonts, the web storage API  (`window.localStorage` and `window.sessionStorage`) etc. And in the future, new browser features that will be HTTPS-only may have problems as well.

The status-quo is to either hand-build your own test-runner HTML file to launch (in which case you're basically discarding half of what makes Chutzpah great; autodiscovering all your tests based on a glob match) or to exclusively rely on PhantomJS which had its web-security flags explicitly switched off to disable same-origin protections, etc.

Why not spin up a simple server that is capable of serving static files for both the test adapter and the context-menu integrated launchers?

title: Tests are culture-dependent
body:
I have my regional settings set to Hungarian, which uses comma as a decimal separator. However, some tests (at least `NUnit2XmlTransformerFacts.Will_generate_testsuite_for_each_file` and `JUnitXmlTransformerFacts.Will_generate_junit_xml` contain hardcoded numbers in the expected output with dot as separator, therefore they fail when the application is run with a culture which has a different setting ([of which there are quite a lot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decimal_mark#Hindu.E2.80.93Arabic_numeral_system)).

About the tests mentioned above: (NUnit [uses a simple ToString()](https://github.com/nunit/nunit/blob/master/src/NUnitEngine/Addins/nunit-v2-result-writer/NUnit2XmlResultWriter.cs#L245) to output numbers (=the separator depends on CurrentCulture), I haven't checked JUnit.) There might be other tests having this problem, but I don't have all the tools installed to run e.g. integrations tests.

title: Fixed NUnit output format (#433)
body: (see https://github.com/nunit/nunit/blob/master/src/NUnitEngine/Addins/nunit-v2-result-writer/NUnit2XmlResultWriter.cs#L234)

title: Version of QUnit is outdated
body:
At present, the version of Qunit that is installed alongside Chutzpah is 1.18.0 (released 03 April 2015). The most recent version of QUnit is 1.20.0 (27 October 2015). Could it be updated, please? 

My understanding is that this is intended to be configurable via the Chutzpah.json settings file (https://github.com/mmanela/chutzpah/wiki/Chutzpah.json-Settings-File). Though my understanding also is that this only works for Jasmine at present. 

An example of tests that are breaking invalidly because the version of QUnit is too old is provided here:

```
http://jsfiddle.net/v82zr0ap/2/
```

An example of those same tests passing with the more recent version of QUnit is provided here:

```
http://jsfiddle.net/v82zr0ap/1/
```

title: Chutzpah module dependencies injection not working
Urgent! An exception occurred while invoking executor 'executor://chutzpah-js/': Unable to find headless browser: phantomjs.exe
body:
Please read my previous issue : https://github.com/mmanela/chutzpah/issues/402

Couple pointers :
1. This happens every 10-15 days or so after we fix it temporarily using one of the below solutions
2. I see that this error goes away when I somehow build a new version of chutzpah.dll after pulling the repo on my local.
3. It also goes away when the build controller is restarted.

Please let me know what you want me to do to reproduce it.
Also, I was not able to generate a log file. After I added a .runsettings file using this 
https://chutzpah.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=tfsbuild

```
<RunSettings>
 <ChutzpahAdapterSettings>
   <EnabledTracing>True</EnabledTracing>
 </ChutzpahAdapterSettings>
</RunSettings>
```

and added it to the Build Controllers custom option/settings file, it properly errored out saying this :
     An exception occurred while invoking executor 'executor://chutzpah-js/': An error occurred while initializing the settings provider named 'ChutzpahAdapterSettings'. Error: There is an error in XML document (4, 5). There is an error in XML document (4, 5). The string 'True' is not a valid Boolean value. See [http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=254169](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=254169)

But when I fixed it by changing True to 'true', it still didn't give me any log file and started giving me the same headless error :(

title: Test Suites in NUnit format have wrong "success" attribute
body: The NUnit 2 output format puts the count of passed test cases in the `success` attribute of `test-suite` tags, but according to [the official documentation](https://github.com/nunit/nunit/wiki/XML-Formats), it should be a string value, `True` or `False`. The problem is in [this line](https://github.com/mmanela/chutzpah/blob/b85eaf4b7591da679e0edd6f3cafdc39e3f134e7/Chutzpah/Transformers/NUnitXmlTransformer.cs#L98).

title: Does Chutzpah support the Team Build Test Filter syntax?
body:
I know that I can configure Chutzpah to run multiple times by pointing it to different chutzpah.json files containing the test configuration.

I wonder whether Chutzpah supports the Test Filter syntax which NUnit and MsTest support. I've written a blog post about this in the past and have been trying to make it work for other frameworks. I understand that certain attributes may translate badly, but others should be no problem.

More information:
- http://blog.jessehouwing.nl/2015/01/staged-execution-of-unit-tests-on-team.html

title: Chutzpah fails build with empty test, but locally marks test as pass
body:

Given a test with no expectations:

describe("Empty Test", function () {
    it("should fail", function () {
    });
});

Locally, this test passes (context menu):

1 passed, 0 failed, 1 total (chutzpah).

========== Total Tests: 1 passed, 0 failed, 1 total ==========

And it passes in the text explorer as well:

Test Name:  Empty Test should fail
Test FullName:  d:\2012devel..\branches\dev...\tests...\controllers\temporarytest.js::empty test::should fail
Test Source:    d:\2012devel...\branches\dev...\tests...\controllers\temporarytest.js : line 3
Test Outcome:   Passed
Test Duration:  0:00:00.002

On the server, however, this test causes the build to fail:

Error: Spec 'Empty Test should fail' has no expectations.
at specDone in file:///C:/Builds/5/.../src/packages/Chutzpah.4.1.0/tools/TestFiles/jasmine/v2/jasmine-html.js (line 105)
While Running:C:\Builds\5...\bin_PublishedWebsites...\Tests...\controllers\TemporaryTest.js

Note:  The failure does show up, on careful inspection, when run locally but only through the "Run JS Tests" context menu.  Unfortunately, in long test runs, it will be obscured by the other tests, and by the final test status (above).  However, there is no indication of a problem in the Test Explorer.  

Recommendation:  Mark the test as failed, or change the message to "Warning" in the output.

[13:11:02] Error: EPERM, unlink 'C:\Projects\CustomerMaintenance\src\CustomerMaintenance\wwwroot\app\directives\CustomerDetails'

title: Test discovery fails if JS tests reside in project with .js. in name
body:
It seems the Discovery process of Chutzpah fails if the project containing the JS test has a name with "JS" (or possibly ".JS.") in it.

Here is the output in Output/Tests window of VS2015:

```
----- Discover test started ------
Error: Timeout occurred when executing test file
While Running:c:\CENSORED\development-branches\dev-vs15-olof\src\projects\CENSORED.web.ui.js.test\tests\testchutzpah.js

========== Discover test finished: 0 found (0:00:12,206) ==========
```

Note path of project: **CENSORED.web.ui.js.test**.

Relevant section of **%temp%\chutzpah.log:**

```
vstest.discoveryengine.x86.exe Information: 0 : Time:16:34:18.6252807; Thread:11; Message:Phantom Log - onPageLoaded
vstest.discoveryengine.x86.exe Error: 0 : Time:16:34:18.6332807; Thread:11; Message:Eror recieved from Phantom Error opening c:/CENSORED/development-branches/dev-vs15-olof/src/projects/CENSORED.web.ui.test/tests/testchutzpah.js: The system cannot find the path specified.
```

Notice how the project name, **CENSORED.web.ui.test** does not contain ".js" anymore!

My guess is that something inside of Chutzpah/Test adapter (or possibly the Visual Studio test discovery subsystem) assumes Visual Studio project names do not contain ".js" in them - maybe even doing some "string".replace(".js", "") hack somewhere? :)
# Workaround

Rename test project to something that does not contain ".js." in the name, both project name and physical path.

title: TFS 2015 test publish of trx - namespace issue
body:
I am able to publish the chutzpah trx files via MSTest just fine. We are trying to use the "Publish Test Results" step in the new TFS build system (https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/vs/alm/Build/feature-overview), but get this error:

```
Failed to publish test results: 'ns' is an undeclared prefix. Line 2, position 10.
```

The normal VS test runner creates trx files with this in the <TestRun> attributes:

```
xmlns="http://microsoft.com/schemas/VisualStudio/TeamTest/2010"
```

Chutzpah, in addition, puts this:

```
 xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" 
```

If we manually remove these attributes, it works fine. I'm not sure why the new TFS build complains about this. A flag to exclude these declarations (or just exclude by default) should resolve the issue.

title: Support running multiple test harnesses within single phantom JS instance
body:
It would be nice if I could run multiple test harnesses within a single phantom JS instance.  That would provide a performance improvement by saving the work of starting and stopping phantom for each test harness.  Each test harness would be a separate page load in the single phantom instance.  Ideally this would work in concert with the parallelism option, so that I have one phantom instance per processor.

I have looked into the batching option that is currently available, and it does not provide me with the flexibility that I want.  With batching, it appears that I need to define a single set of references for all of the test files in my batch.  I prefer to have each test have only the minimal set of references needed to run successfully, so that the tests remain small and targeted.  As far as I can tell, this is not possible with batching.  The set of references would need to be the superset of the references for all of the tests in the batch, so that all the tests can run within the same harness.

title: Supply own Jasmine libraries option
body:
Hello!

I've just set up Chutzpah on a TypeScript project, and I'm loving it so far!

One thing I have noticed, and was wondering if something could be added for it, is that the provided version of Jasmine (and presumably Mocha and QUnit) sometimes lags behind the version that bower will bring in. In our project we had a separate test runner HTML file, that we were initially using for tests, and obviously there we could bring in the latest versions of everything (so we might end up using things provided by the later versions).

I was thinking that maybe there could be a way to specify that certain references will override the built in testing libraries. When something like that is done, it's obviously down to the user to make sure they reference everything.

I guess I could try and fake it by making a custom harness file, or by replacing Jasmine in the extension installation, but something more official would be nicer.

Is this something I can already do, or is this something worth pursuing do you think?

title: Erroneous chutzpah.json Samples
body:
Just wanted to let you know about some samples I found here today in the documentation that do not match their corresponding _"table of supported settings"_:

**Chutzpah.json Settings File**
https://github.com/mmanela/chutzpah/wiki/Chutzpah.json-Settings-File
One example contains the line `"TypeScriptCodeGenTarget" : "ES5",`, but the property _TypeScriptCodeGenTarget_ is not listed among the supported properties at the beginning of the article.

**Compile Setting**
https://github.com/mmanela/chutzpah/wiki/compile-setting
All examples in that article contain settings for _References_ and _Tests_ in the form of:

```
"References": [
   {"Include": "**/src/**.ts", "Exclude": "**/src/**.d.ts" }
 ],
 "Tests": [
   { "Include": "**/test/**.ts", "Exclude": "**/test/**.d.ts" }
```

But according to the tables of supported properties in the respective articles for _References_ and _Tests_ the `Include` / `Exclude` must actually be `Includes` / `Excludes`.

title: Remove BOM from transformed result output
body: Fixes #411. The BOM causes errors when read by many Java libraries, including those used by Jenkins. It's optional, so it can simply be removed, making (in particular) Jenkins integration easier.

title: XML output transformers include a byte order mark
body:
Adding the byte-order mark to UTF-8 is optional according to the standard, but many Java-based parsers fail to accept it.

In particular, this causes Jenkins' JUnit handling to fail, as well as a plugin that transforms TRX output.

Since it is optional, and it creates problems when integrating the output of Chutzpah with Jenkins, it would be good to drop the BOM from the output entirely.

Pull request coming.

title: Use seconds for timings in JUnit XML
body:
Fixes #409. The timings in the JUnit XML format are required to be in
seconds, not milliseconds.

title: JUnit XML outputs times in milliseconds instead of seconds
body:
JUnit XML includes timing information in decimal seconds. The `JUnitXmlTransformer` is writing milliseconds however. See the JUnit source for XML output [on apache.org](http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk/src/main/org/apache/tools/ant/taskdefs/optional/junit/XMLJUnitResultFormatter.java) as a reference for this issue.

This creates difficulty when integrating with Jenkins.

Pull request coming.

title: adds /coverageIgnore option to exclude files from code coverage results
body: My implementation of a solution for #404. Adds a /coverageIgnore command-line option (and corresponding "CodeCoverageIgnores" option in chutzpah.json), much like the existing /coverageInclude and /coverageExclude options. Ignored files are not added to the CoverageData object, thus don't appear in the coverage output.

title: Include files for code coverage but exclude from summary

The only reason I care to exclude these files is that they inflate the "Average Coverage" number that Chutzpah outputs at the top of its Code Coverage results.

This would give me correct output without having to worry about dependencies.

title: Provide coverage report format Jenkins can consume
body:
This is a request to add a code coverage output format that [Jenkins](https://jenkins-ci.org/) can consume. I cannot find a way to integrate Chutzpah's lcov output with Jenkins. It should be possible to integrate Chutzpah's HTML output vis the [HTML Publisher](https://wiki.jenkins-ci.org/display/JENKINS/HTML+Publisher+Plugin) plugin, but with the right output I could leverage a plugin to create reports with drill down and links to source files. Here is what my research has turned up:
- [Istanbul](https://github.com/gotwarlost/istanbul) had a [similar feature request](https://github.com/gotwarlost/istanbul/issues/17) and added a [Cobertura](http://cobertura.github.io/cobertura/) output format that the popular [Cobertura plugin](https://wiki.jenkins-ci.org/display/JENKINS/Cobertura+Plugin) can consume. [JSCover](http://tntim96.github.io/JSCover/) also supports this format.
- [Emma](http://emma.sourceforge.net/index.html) has an [XML format](http://emma.sourceforge.net/samples.html) that the [Emma Plugin](https://wiki.jenkins-ci.org/display/JENKINS/Emma+Plugin) for Jenkins can consume.
- Visual Studio (MSTest) can generate .coveragexml files that the [MSTest Plugin](https://wiki.jenkins-ci.org/display/JENKINS/MSTest+Plugin) for Jenkins can consume. [Report Generator](https://github.com/danielpalme/ReportGenerator) can also consume this format and output human-readable reports in various formats. I found this unofficial [XSD](https://github.com/tsimbalar/CodeCoverageParser/blob/master/CoverageXml/xsd/coverage.coveragexml.xsd) that might help.

I hope you will consider adding support for one of these to Chutzpah to make it easier to integrate with Jenkins and other tools.

title: An exception occurred while invoking executor 'executor://chutzpah-js/': Unable to find headless browser: phantomjs.exe
body:
We are getting this error on TFS.

title: Visual Studio 2015 Enterprise - No Tests Found.

title: Chutzpah takes a long time while scanning unnecessary files
body:
I have the following project structure:

```
. _ProjectRoot
+-- _gulp
+-- _js
|   +-- _tests
|   +-- jquery.js
+-- _node_modules
|   +-- _<big folder structure>
+-- chutzpah.json
```

Given the following chutzpah.json

```
{
    "Tests":
    [
        { "Path": "js/tests", "Includes": [ "*Tests.js" ] }
    ]
}
```

When I right-click on the project inside Visual Studio and select "Run JS Tests", the chutzpah.log indicates that Chutzpah is spending about 2 minutes just scanning the node_modules folder looking for settings files and trying to build a test context for every javascript file it finds.  Due to the filter in the settings file, it correctly discards them.

Given my settings file filters out any javascript files outside of js/tests, why is Chutzpah spending 2 minutes looking elsewhere?  The time to look in js/tests is only 10 seconds.  The total time for the test run is almost 4 minutes. Half the time needlessly scanning node_modules.

Ironically, when I run the same tests and folder structure under a TFS build with the Test Sources Spec set to `ProjectRoot\**\*Tests.js`, chutzpah never even looks outside js\tests for additional settings files or tries to build test contexts in node_modules.

Is there some configuration that I'm missing?  How can I tell Chutzpah not to scan the node_modules folder?

**Update:** I'm not very good at markup. I don't know how to draw a folder structure. Just to clarify, the items in my attempt with an underscore are to represent folders.  The underscore isn't actually part of the name.

title: Parallelism setting when running Chutzpah under a TFS build
body:
We have our TFS (2013) build configured to run javascript qunit tests under Chutzpah (4.0.3) by following [this post](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/visualstudioalm/archive/2012/07/09/javascript-unit-tests-on-team-foundation-service-with-chutzpah.aspx). Is there a way to adjust the amount of parallelism? I'd like to set it to 1 to help diagnose some random failures.

title: Change location of chutzpah.log during tfs build
body:
I'm trying to diagnose some random failures of qunit tests during our tfs (2013) builds. By turning on tracing, I can get chutzpah (4.0.3) to generate a log file in %TEMP%.

However, our build agents could have multiple instances executing and I'm concerned about multiple runs of Chutzpah writing to the same log file. Is there a configuration option for each instance to write to a different log file?

In addition, is there a way to configure the build to automatically copy the log file to the tfs drop location?

title: Jasmine-Matchers
Unexpected console.log in tests using Jasmine and Chutzpah
body:
When using Chutzpah to run jasmine tests I see unexpected console.log messages.

test:

``` javascript
expect(console.log.calls.count()).toEqual(1);
console.info('[call count]', console.log.calls.count(), '[num calls history]', console.log.calls.allArgs().length, '[all calls as string]', console.log.calls.allArgs().join('<==seperator==>'));
```

output:

```
Log Message: [call count] 2 [num calls history] 2 [all calls as string] !!_!! isTestingDone<==seperator==>(removed expected single console log message) from (removed filename).js
```

My guess is the following lines are adding the unexpected console log messages:
https://github.com/mmanela/chutzpah/blob/master/Chutzpah/JSRunners/jasmineRunnerV2.js#L14

I have many tests that observe the console.log messages and what I find strange it that only two tests actually have the extra log messages from jasmineRunner showing up in them. Not sure why more haven't failed up to this point yet.

Either way it seems like the extra logs are probably unnecessary in jasmineRunner.

Chutzpah 3.2.5

title: PhantomJS crashes when running chutzpah.console.exe
body:
I get the following error:
**_Error: Unknown error occurred when executing test file. Received exit code of -1073741819
While Running:**_C:...one-of-mytestfiles.js

This happens often, but not every time, seems worse on the build machine - but it does happen on my workstation as well.

If I capture the temporary html file the console app creates and the command line it uses to execute PhantomJS (sysinternal's process monitor and process explorer are _the best_) I can recreate this outside the your console application.

PhantomJS says this:

PhantomJS has crashed. Please read the crash reporting guide at https://github.com/ariya/phantomjs/wiki/Crash-Reporting and file a bug report at https
://github.com/ariya/phantomjs/issues/new with the crash dump file attached: <path to a dump file>

Without symbols the dump was pretty useless.

I can, however, pinpoint the test the fails, but it's nearly identical to other similar tests in that file, so I can't see what I could be doing "wrong" enough to crash the browser. This test, the tests in that file, and the tests in other files all run file in Visual Studio using your tool. They also run fine in the Jasmine test runner page we also use. 

**While this isn't really a Chutzpah issue, but I have a few requests:**

**1. I'd like to see if PhantomJS 2.0 fixes this.** You're using 1.9. Dropping the new version into the install directory doesn't work. The first issue was chutzpahRunner.js doesn't work. See this:

http://phantomjs.org/api/phantom/property/args.html

I fixed that issue, but I still can get it to work. Now I see this:
# _#Error#_# {"type":"Error","error":{"message":"Protocol \"e\" is unknown"}}
# _#Log#_# {"type":"Log","log":{"message":"!!_!! Resource Error: e:%5Csrc%5CPRODUCTVSO%5CMain%5CMY PRODUCT%5CSource%5CPRODUCT%5Cpackages%5CChutzpah.3.3.1%5Ctools%5CJSRunners%5CjasmineRunnerV2.js"}}
# _#Log#_# {"type":"Log","log":{"message":"!!_!! Resource Recieved: e:%5Csrc%5CPRODUCTVSO%5CMain%5CMY%20PRODUCT%5CSource%5CPRODUCT%5Cpackages%5CChutzpah.3.3.1%5Ctools%5CJSRunners%5CjasmineRunnerV2.js"}}
# _#Log#_# {"type":"Log","log":{"message":"!!_!! onInitialized  Jasmine - v2"}}
# _#Log#_# {"type":"Log","log":{"message":"!!_!! isJasmineLoaded"}}

**Have you investigated using PhantomJS 2.0?** Any suggestions on how to make this work to see if 2.0 fixes the problem?

**2. Logging the current  test executing after a crash**
It would have been nice if the the console application logged the currently running test when PhantomJS crashed. I can see this "#_#TestStart#_#" {...} right before it crashes so I would think this is possible. Also I see an error message from PhantomJS  written on out to stderr, why not include that in the log too?

title: Chutzpah fails when there're many node_modules files in a project.
body:
I have a project that worked previously, but **as I added node_modules folder** to the project with many js files in it, Chutzpah started to fail.
No other changes performed, and **node_modules folder not included in Chutzpah.json file**.

The cause of failure is unknown to me, this may be large amount of files, or some specific js file that when attached to project causes Chutzpah to fail. There is no obvious error in trace file. In both cases, the file is **not included** to Chutzpah.json.

Steps to reproduce:
- Use latest Chutzpah adapter plugin.
- Git Clone [kendo-pouchdb project](https://github.com/terikon/kendo-pouchdb).
- Run 'npm install' to install dependencies.
- Open /KendoPouchDB.sln file.
- Open test explorer.
- The test explorer will fail, with 'Error: One or more errors occurred.' in chutzpah.log.

Now to make Chutzpah work again:
- Close the solution.
- Go to node_modules folder.
- Remove all folders that contain 'grunt' in their names:
  - grunt
  - grunt-contrib-jasmine
  - grunt-contrib-jshint
  - grunt-contrib-uglify
  - grunt-kendo-lint
  - load-grunt-tasks
- Open the solution.
- Go to test explorer.
- Tests will appear!

_Visual Studio 2013, Chutzpah Test Adapter 4.0.3._

title: NUnit2 xml results output
body:
For issue #206
Only for NUnit 2.0. I may work on NUnit 3.0 format at a later time but that's still in pre-release.

Just an NUnit2XmlTransformer and respective additions to the Transformer factory.

Handles the test groups.

title: VS Debugger Support (2nd attempt)
body:
Revised implementation as previously discussed (#381).

Now developed in VS2013. The problem with VS.Common was something to do with the way I was copying DLLs directly into the TestWindow\Extensions folder, I think.

Another odd thing was that if I DON'T bump the version number but keep the current number (4.0.3), installing the newly built VSIX package results in the previous, originally-installed package being re-installed. Furthermore, when building with the original version number, it seems to want to re-install the newly built package, right there during the build process. Finally, if the VS process doesn't have admin rights that attempt eventually bombs out after a couple of minutes.

It seems that the build.bat should be run as `build package 4.0.4` or whatever version number is required, that then overwriting any current version numbers in the in the AssemblyInfo.cs files.

Anyhow, when built as 4.0.4 and vsix installed into 2013, doing a right-click on a Test item in the test window with a BP set in the script, IE gets launched and the script breaks at the BP in the IDE.

Tested on Windows 7 x64 and IE 11.

title: Adapter debug support
body:
Thank you for this useful project.

The one thing missing for me was script debugging from the Test Adapter. The goal was to set a breakpoint in a test script, right click the entry for the test in Test Explorer, select Debug Selected Test, then have the debugger load and break at that BP.

So I've had a go at getting that to work. It's quite a large PR so no worries if it doesn't get merged, but wanted to communicate how you might go about implementing that feature.

Essentially, I've taken a look at how Visual Studio debugs a script and worked out how to do that programatically when the test adapter is executed in IsBeingDebugged==true mode.

The test result are communicated in the browser, as with the OpenInBrowser mode.

title: Jasmine test fails when run in Chutzpah but not in browser
body:
Maybe there is some aspect of this I am not understanding, but I have a test that passes perfectly when I open it in the browser but fails miserably when I run it in Visual Studio. 

Here is a link to [my stackoverflow question](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/31443109/jasmine-test-fails-when-run-in-chutzpah-but-not-in-browser/31443260#31443260) on the subject.

Example code that breaks test:

``` javascript
var nameLowerCase = person.PersonName.toLowerCase();
var searchLowerCase= search.toLowerCase();
return (nameLowerCase.includes(searchLowerCase));
```

Error output: 

> Message: TypeError: undefined is not a constructor (evaluating 'nameLowerCase.includes(searchLowerCase)') ...

I solved the issue by using a Regex instead, but thought I'd post it here in case (a) it is a bug or (b) you guys can tell me something I'm doing wrong.

title: QUnit skipped tests show as passed in Visual Studio
body: I am using Chutzpah to run QUnit tests in Visual Studio Test Explorer. QUnit has a skip function for incomplete tests (https://api.qunitjs.com/QUnit.skip/) and the Visual Studio Test Explorer has a section for Skipped Tests, but tests which are skipped in QUnit show up as Passed in Visual Studio.

title: Blanket Coverage: Only proceed to map to local path when URI scheme is file
body: I believe the chutzpah.json config file uses the References to include files that are local that should be loaded for testing. The fellow that setup our TypeScript tests also included http:// references to files that were needed (mostly angular related). I found that this broke when used with the /codecoverage option because it tries to determine the LocalPath of the URI. This change makes sure that only file based URIs are checked for their LocalPath.

title: Fixes #373
body: Adding *.cshtml to the list of file extensions that is allowed to be embedded in the test via the <template/> tag.

title: Typescript Breakpoints Fail
body:
Per `Compile` configuration element.

`This setting lets you describe in the Chutzpah.json file how to execute a command which can compile your source files to .js files. You tell Chutzpah what to execute and some information about what your executable does (like where to find the generated .js files). Then after running the executable Chutzpah can associate each source file with each output file to still give the nice behavior of mapping tests back to their original files.`

I interpret this to mean that the js.map files are utilized properly and therefore breakpoints in the original TS source should work.

Everything else is working properly.

When I place a breakpoint in a Typescript unit test, it fails to break when `Test->Debug->All Tests`.

It also fails to break when right clicking and selecting the Chutzpah menu item to `Open in Browser`.

title: No test found with TypeScript file
Code coverage problem since 4.0.2 when the path to _Chutzpah.coverage.html contain a space.

There's a bug in 4.0.2 release when the browser open after the execution of code coverage in visual studio 2013 with the "Chutzpah Test Adapter for Test Explorer".

The bug occur when the _Chutzpah.coverage.html is located in a folder where the path contain a space.

Before 4.0.2 you could use any default browser and it worked all fine. But since the 4.0.2 it only work in Internet Explorer. In other browsers there's two tabs opening; one with the part before the space and one with the part after the space. (In 4.0.1 the path was formatted with %20 for the space but it is no longer this way in 4.0.2)

I tested in 4.0.1 and this bug is not occuring.

title: Adding Mark of the Web to prevent scripts blocking in Internet Explorer
body:
I've added [Mark of the Web](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms537628.aspx) to harness files to make IE think that file is serve from Internet instead of file system with for some reasons have more restrictions. Please follow the link for details.

I find no way to unit test this, but I have tested it locally and it works for me.
Hope you find this fix useful.

openInBrowser enhancement
body:

value. such as ie, chrome and firefox. Chutzpah will try to open the
test page in the psecified browser. If browser name is not provided,

default browser is found, Chutzpah will open the test page using the
default app for html file

title: Chutzpah try to find generated js files ignoring OutDirectory option in compile setting in chutzpah.json
The openinbrowser is not working when the default app for html file is not set to a browser
body:
When The chutzpah.console.exe has a /openInBrowser parameter, it will open the test case in a browser. However if the default app used to open html file is set to non-browser app, such as notepad, the test page will be opened in notepad instead. 

It would be nice if Chutzpah could load the browser properly when the default app for html file is not set to a browser.

title: Chutzpah needs to issue a warning/error if no generated file found for .ts file
body: If you forget to put a batch compile setting in your chutzpah.json then Chutzpah will never warn you that it didn't find a generated file for a given .ts file. It should probably be a error/exception.

title: UseSourceMaps setting doesn't show up for auto-completion.

body:

title: Abstract headless browser from main code
body: Have you considered abstracting the headless browser from the main code so that it would be feasible to use different headless browsers with Chutzpah (for instance, SlimerJS) by custom implementation of the interface?

title: Previously successful tests showing as failed only in VS Text Explorer after upgrade to 4.0
body:
After upgrading the VS 2012 Test Adapter to 4.0 I'm now noticing that several tests which were previously passing are now showing as failed.

The strange part is when I choose "Open in Browser" from the context menu extension the tests then all show as successful.

I'm using mocha as my testing framework with "bdd" style.  The tests that were previously passing before upgrading and now failing all seem to have one thing in common which is that they involve a spy on a global method (i.e. var spy = sinon.spy(window, "globalMethodNameHere" );)

Anyone else experiencing this issue?  It's almost like the VS parser isn't interpreting the results?  I'm not sure how to debug this.

@mmanela - I have two chutzpah.log files which may be of use here.  Is there a way I can privately share these to you?  I'd prefer not to publicly post them if possible.

Also, is there anyway to download the previous version?  I'd like to get back to a stable build until I can get this issue resolved.  Thanks in advance.

title: Typescript 1.4 / Jasmine 2.2 tests not found using chutzpah.json
Test Adapter doesn't work without full Visual Studio install
body:
On a machine with just the [Agents for Microsoft Visual Studio](http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=40750) installed, the chutzpah test adapter cannot be loaded. Agents for Microsoft Visual Studio is used to run tests in a lab environment without the full Visual Studio installation.

This problem is occurring because the test adapter dll has a dependency on Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestWindow.Interfaces.dll, which is not present in the Agents install. To fix this, Visual Studio UI dependencies will have to be taken out of the TestAdapter dll.

title: IndexOutOfRangeException while running with code coverage
body:
I'm seeing this Exception during automated build (TFS build) with code coverage enabled:

```
Error: System.IndexOutOfRangeException: Index was outside the bounds of the array.
   at System.Collections.Generic.List`1.Add(T item)
   at Chutzpah.Coverage.BlanketJsCoverageEngine.AddExcludePatterns(IEnumerable`1 patterns)
   at Chutzpah.TestContextBuilder.GetConfiguredCoverageEngine(TestOptions options, ChutzpahTestSettingsFile chutzpahTestSettings)
   at Chutzpah.TestContextBuilder.SetupCodeCoverageEngine(TestOptions options, ChutzpahTestSettingsFile chutzpahTestSettings, IFrameworkDefinition definition, List`1 referencedFiles)
   at Chutzpah.TestContextBuilder.BuildContext(PathInfo file, TestOptions options)

   at Chutzpah.TestRunner.<>c__DisplayClass7.<BuildTestContexts>b__6(PathInfo testFile)
```

According to .NET this comes from concurrent access to the lists. But I have never seen this issue. What could be the cause?

title: Resolve dependency issue when .Net 4.5.1 or > is present
body: The installation was failing with an error "The extension 'Chutzpah Test Adapter for the Test Explorer' requires a version of the .NET Framework that is not installed." when .Net 4.5.1 was installed. Change allows 4.5 or greater to be present.

title: Select what browser to use as default for running tests
body:
The Visual Studio plugin (https://github.com/mmanela/chutzpah/wiki/chutzpah-visual-studio-extensions) adds a right click option to run a test or test-folder in the browser. This works great.

However, I prefer to debug my front end in Chrome, because of its (IMHO) better debugging capabilities. Because of that, I would prefer to have the tests run in Chrome by default - and not Internet Explorer.

It would be nice to add a configuration option to set the default browser for running tests - or maybe add all system browers in the right click menu, so that you can select what browser you want launched for any given test.

title: Moving UseSourceMaps setting to within the Compile setting
body: Per discussion on #316, moving UseSourceMaps setting to Compile section rather than having it be a top-level configuration setting.

title: Chutzpah does not execute the new module() methods in Qunit
body:
Is there any way to setup what Qunit version chutzpah uses? I just downloaded the latest version of chutzpah, but it doesn't seem to support the latest module methods. However, the old one works.

To elaborate, "setup" and "teardown" works, but they are deprecated and have been replaced by "beforeEach" and "afterEach", which never gets called when running tests through chutzpah.

http://api.qunitjs.com/QUnit.module/

Edit: It seems that the current release is using QUnit 1.14, and the methods were introduced in 1.16. Just updating the file results in a timeout when running a test.

title: Fix #308 - adds source-map support for code coverage line number translation
body:
Introduces support for discovering and parsing source-map files to convert code coverage information between generated and original source files.
- New chutzpah.json option, 'UseSourceMaps', default false
- Seeks sourcemap files based on filename convention, file.js -> file.js.map - future extension might seek specially-formed comments in the generated output
- Both LCOV output and browser-based coverage summary should now be more accurate

![sourcemap support example](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1470336/5789337/ba65773a-9e5e-11e4-905f-f45210f89f07.png)

Brings with it two new dependencies:
- SourceMapDotNet, a library I wrote (port of a Mozilla lib) specifically to parse sourcemap files for Chutzpah
- Newtonsoft Json.Net - dependency of SourceMapDotNet

Suggest a local build before any merging after my line-ending issues last time! Feedback on approach welcome.

body:
Dears, 

I'm using the configuration as in the title but I cannot set Chutzpah up to work even if I've rad and tried all'about I've found about using direcly compiled js files, compile with specifying tsc to use, and so on. I'm sure it's my fault but I can't find out the solution it may work for me and now I'm very confused. All the code seems to compile well and using only quint in another project and, without Chutzpah, sync and async tests works fine. 

My files are organized in this way: 

SolutionDir/cm/data/*.ts => all the classes I want to test are in the CM-project (there are also other folders other than data but for the moment I would be happy let it work for data) 

SolutionDir/cm/scipts/*.ts => support classes for all classes in data (only 2 classes are used and 2 .d.ts). 

SolutionDir/tests/unit/data/.ts => all the unit-tests classes are in a separate Tests-project, normally organized in 1 or more files thought to test 1 specific cm/data/xxx.ts file-class using 1 or more test() clause. Also here I have other ./unit/otherforders/.ts files that tests the same ./cm/data files or other files in ./cm/otherfolders. But I would be happy for now to let the ./data/\* bring to work. 

SolutionDir/tests/unit/Facroty.ts => factory class I use within allmost all tests and is "referenced" within the test files. 

Premise: 
I've installed the "Chutzpah Test Runner Context Menu Extension" and what here reported comes from starting every time the same test file (with only 1 test() clause) by right click on them and select then "Chutzpah-ICON Run JS Tests" entry.
I've placed the Chutzpah.json file and/or the complile.bat file in SolutionDir/tests/unit/data.
Installing the "Chutzpah Test Adapter for the Test Explorer" the errors compares on the output windows under the voice "test" every time I compile all
Case 1: not using any Chutzpah.json file 
i got many of these: errors TS1056: Accessors are only available when targeting ECMAScript 5 and higher. 
I've verified and the errors refers to the use of getters and setters of TS. 

Case 2: using only ES5 flag: 
Chutzpah.json file: 
{
"TypeScriptCodeGenTarget": "ES5"
} 
and I got many of these: error TS1008: Unexpected token; 'constructor, function, accessor or variable' expected. 
I've verified and the errors refers to the use of "protected" accessor modifiers and so on of TS 1.3. 

Case 3: try to use external flag: 
Chutzpah.json file: 
{
"TypeScriptCodeGenTarget": "ES5",
"Compile": {
    "Mode": "External",
    "SourceDirectory": "../../../../CM/data"
}
} 
and I got only this unique error: 
Error: Called start() while already started (QUnit.config.semaphore was 0 already) 
While Running:C:\TFS\ChefMagic\dev-cm\Tests\Unit\data\Activity_tests.ts 

Case 3: try to use external flag and path settings: 
Chutzpah.json file: 
{
"TypeScriptCodeGenTarget": "ES5",
"Framework": "qunit",
"Compile": {
    "Mode": "External",
    "Extensions": [ ".ts" ],
    "ExtensionsWithNoOutput": [ ".d.ts" ],
    "SourceDirectory": "../../../../CM/data",
    "OutDirectory": "../../../../CM/data"
},
"Tests": [
    { "Include": "_.ts", "Exclude": "_.d.ts" }
],
"References": [
    { "Include": "../../../../CM/_/_.ts", "Exclude": "../../../../CM/_/_.d.ts" }
]
} 
and i get the same error as before: 
Error: Called start() while already started (QUnit.config.semaphore was 0 already) 
While Running:C:\TFS\ChefMagic\dev-cm\Tests\Unit\data\Activity_tests.ts 

Case 4: specify the tsc for compile: 
Chutzpah.json file: 
{
"TypeScriptCodeGenTarget": "ES5",
"Framework": "qunit",
"Compile": {
    "Extensions": [ ".ts" ],
    "ExtensionsWithNoOutput": [ ".d.ts" ],
    "Executable": "compile.bat",
    "SourceDirectory": "../../../../CM/data",
    "OutDirectory": "../../../../CM/data"
},
"Tests": [
    { "Include": "_.ts", "Exclude": "_.d.ts" }
],
"References": [
    { "Include": "../../../../CM/data/_.ts", "Exclude": "../../../../CM/data/_.d.ts" }
]
} 
complie.bat file: 
@echo off 
tsc Activity_tests.ts --sourcemap 

and i got the same errors as before: TS1056 and TS1008 that relates to the use of ES5 and TS1.3 

Note: If I now remove the Chutzpah.json file at all I got this error: 
Chutzpah Error: ChutzpahCompilationFailedException - File not found 
While Running:C:\TFS\ChefMagic\dev-cm\Tests\Unit\data\chutzpah.json 

So, what's wrong with me? It's important to notice that VS2015 comes with TS allready installed but it seems not to work and so it was necessary to install TS1.3 for 2013 on top of VS2015 after it was ready and then all seems to work perfectly (compilation and quint tests without Chutzpah). 

Thank you in advance. 
Davide

title: Add line-level source map support
body:
Chutzpah is currently able to identify a generated source file from its original source, but not to map between the two files line-by-line.

This means that for situations where a language is compiling down to JavaScript, like with Typescript, Chutzpah can't output accurate code coverage information:
- Code coverage percentages may be inaccurate as they relate to the number of uncovered vs covered lines in the generated, rather than original source
- Code coverage breakdowns (via the context menu extension) show the correct original source filenames, but expand to generated source

Obviously this is pretty minor, but it's something I may need for integration with Sonarqube so I'm opening this to have something to submit against!

title: File path is missing directories when using with TypeScript and RequireJS
body:
Full description can be seen in this SO post: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/27237091/failing-to-set-up-basic-unit-test-solution-with-chutzpah-typescript-and-require , primarily the Supplement at the bottom.

It seems like that Chutzpah is somehow generating an invalid path when invoking tests. In my case, two directories are missing and thus chutzpah is failing because it can't find the file (obviously). I do not understand how (or rather based on what) Chutzpah is generating this path so I don't really know which further steps I could try to correct this, but an example project is located here: http://tinyurl.com/lg67nxt

title: QUnit 1.16.0 assert.async() is failing
Update to QUnit 1.16.0
body:
QUnit recently released a new version, 1.16.0, which begins the deprecation process for a number of core functions. This issue is for updating Chutzpah to utilize and include this new version of QUnit.

Also be aware that with this version, QUnit has begun the upgrade process to versions 2.0 and 2.1 which will fully deprecate, then remove, certain functionality. Chutzpah should consider this in the solution design and plan for these future transitions.

title: Use of typescript class declarations

tl;dr; Please allow the use of Jasmine 2.1

I've recently started using chutzpah and what I want is the speed to run tests incredibly quickly. Unfortunately Jasmine 2.0 doesn't always allow this (if specs have significant setup/teardown), they've added a `beforeAll` and `afterAll` into version 2.1 which will significantly help in these sorts of problems, but at the moment I can't use these with the NuGet'd chutzpah.

I do want to add btw - after 2 days use these seems a great library!

title: Can't change phantomjs object properties
body:
I need to change the user agent property on the page object used by chutzpah to start the test pages, but there is no way to access that object from the test or any provided extension point. We changed our server api to filter requests based on this header, and now all the tests that were working cannot be rewritten to work with the new limitation.

Other approaches to changing the user agent header, like overriding the browser property, do not work at all, since phantom's page object creates a sandbox with preset values, i.e., it will always use the same header, unless another one is specified through the page.settings.userAgent property.

My actual need is only the user agent setting, but his could be extended to anything related to phantomjs that chutzpah uses. Perhaps another extension point that could interfere in the creation of each object and set custom properties or something similar. Ideally, it would be possible to set these options from within the test itself, since each test could set a different user agent string, or it could be dynamic, in which case a static extension point would also not help.

I had to completely delete my tests that relied on the user agent header, because there wasn't even a workaround to the issue.

This post provides a bit more discussion on this problem:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/26467096/how-do-i-change-the-underlying-phantomjs-object-settings-using-chutzpah/26476186?noredirect=1#comment41592315_26476186

title: Code Coverage with Knockout 3.2.0
Parallelism or asynchronous test running in console vs. Visual Studio
body:
I'm having an intermittent problem where running all the tests from within VS (e.g right-click project, "Run JS Tests") doesn't work reliably, but I cannot reproduce the problem from the console test runner.

The tests seem to be running concurrently from within VS, e.g. the log looks like:

```
------ Test started: File: module1.tests.js ------
------ Test started: File: module2.tests.js ------
3 passed, 0 failed, 3 total (chutzpah).

------ Test started: File: module3.tests.js ------
------ Test started: File: module4.tests.js ------
1 passed, 0 failed, 1 total (chutzpah).

6 passed, 0 failed, 6 total (chutzpah).

5 passed, 0 failed, 5 total (chutzpah).
```

.. this makes it hard to figure out what happened at the end when the total number of tests run is less than expected. I did a diff on the output from two runs, after sorting them, and found that while every file was _started_ in the incomplete scenario, there were missing results lines for some tests. (Impossible to know which because the results are mixed randomly).

So I tried running the tests with the console runner e.g.

```
chutzpah.console /path ../my/app/root
```

It runs all the tests reliably. It also waits for each test to complete before starting the next one, showing the results after the test start notification in each case. 

Even if I set `/parallelism x` (where x > 1) it still doesn't seem to run them concurrently, like it does within the VS test runner.

So I have a few problems - the first is that I can't seem to mimic the conditions under which chutzpah is running from within VS on the command line. Being able to do that might help figure out the actual problem which is that some tests seem to not finish (without a timeout error), but not consistently, and not repeatably, even on identical consecutive runs.

If it helps, I'm using QUnit, AMD testing mode and lots of async with requireJS, requireJs within requireJS, promises, XHR, etc. though the failures seem to occur just as often on the simplest scenarios as the most complex.

title: New lines in PhantomJS console log in VS output window
body:
I'm dealing with a scenario where tests run in the browser but not in PhantomJS, and subsequently am adding console logs to help with troubleshooting. All the logs are output on the same line, e.g.

```
LogMessage: foo bar from c:\... testfile.jsLogMessage: foo foo from c:\...
```

I can't seem to figure out any way to output a new line to the log, this is just using `console.log`. Not the end of the world but it would be much easier to deal with if they were logged to new lines.

If this is not specifically a Chutzpah issue I apologize in advance, I'm not sure if this mechanism is handled by chutzpah or phantomjs in the VS output window.

title: console runner does not return non-zero exit code, when required module is missing
body:
In our test suite, we are using QUnit and require.js and running it from the command line using Chutzpah 3.2

I observed that when one required module was missing on the disk, I got the following message

```
Error: Timeout occurred when executing test file
  While Running:c:\source\...\testSuite.js
```

But the build script did not report a failure. This suggests to me that the console runner did not return a non-zero exit code.

It is not the `testSuite.js` that is missing, but a common module containing helper functions required by multiple test modules required from the test suite.

A broken test, e.g. a failed assertion, does result in the build script reporting a failure, so the build script should correctly detect non-zero exit codes.

title: Support running multiple test files in same harness
body:
It appears as though each test file gets its own harness built and own instance of phantomjs spun up to run its contents, which means that the amount of time running tests is dwarfed by the time spent spinning up and down that infrastructure. Propose an option in chutzpah.json to include multiple test files per harness, off by default as lack of a fresh environment for each set of tests might break tests that aren't able to clean up after themselves. Rought perf example on my local machine (4 core/8 thread, Core i7-3632QM @ 2.20GHz), ~800 tests over 78 files:
SetupTest run duration
1 thread, all test JS files bundled into one (simulation of proposed change)9s
Max parallelism (8 threads), individual files28s
Min parallelism (1 thread), individual files1m20s
Could get more advanced and split test file set by degree of parallelism (i.e. in above case 8 sets of about 10 files each) but this actually runs _slower_ than simply firing everything through one thread. Anecdotally, above 1-big-test-file runs at about 15% CPU on one core while max-parallelism lots-of-test-files maxes out all cores. (nb will look at creating a pull request for this when I find time!) Thanks for the hard work on Chutzpah!

title: Incorrect error when JS is wrong in mocha before()
body:

title: Add support for file-system XHR requests in tests
body:
jamietre[CodePlex]
Using Chutzpah as test runner, any tests that needs to make XHR requests will fail because of cross-domain policy on local file systems. In Chrome you can disable this quotfeaturequot by starting chrome with the quot--disable-web-securityquot flag. In PhantomJS you can also disable this using the quot--local-to-remote-url-accessquot option, see https://github.com/ariya/phantomjs/wiki/API-Reference#command-line-options Ideally we would be able to pass this option (or other phantomJS options) through via Chutzpah config, but even just hardcoding this as the default would be preferable, since this mimics the actual production environment where you can make local XHR requests better than having it disabled. Without this, we can't use the quottextquot RequireJS plugin, which makes it impossible to create good component tests of UI code or generally anything that loads non-JS resources dynamically.

title: Load dependencies before Jasmine unit tests and code coverage
body:
nicoleta_scrimint[CodePlex]
I have a web application implemented with the Durandal framework. Durandal uses other libraries as jquery, knockout, Q, toastr. Beside these third party libraries, I use 'jquery UI' which depends on jquery library and 'knockout validation', which depends on knockout library. First approach Firstly, I put all the third party libraries as paths in the setting quotReferencesquot in the file quotchutzpah.jsonquot. In this way, all the tests were always successfully run, still I had some errors on code coverage such as: quotError: ReferenceError: Can't find variable: ko in file:///.../Scripts/knockout.validation.js (line 2) in file:///.../Scripts/knockout.validation.js (line 22) While Running:...\accordionmanager_test.jsquot quotError: Error: Mismatched anonymous define() module:quot I think this error appear for the non AMD modules as Q, knockout validation, toastr. This approach is shown in the files: quotchutzpah_paths_to_all_dependencies.jsonquot and quotconfigurationForTest_without_require_config_dependencies.jsquot. Second approach I dropped this approach of putting the dependencies in the file quotchutzpah.jsonquot and I configured all the dependencies with requireJs. I load the dependencies with: require.config({ paths: { quotjqueryquot: quot../Scripts/jquery-2.1.0.minquot, quotjquery.uiquot: quot../Scripts/jquery-ui-1.10.3.minquot, quotknockoutquot: quot../Scripts/knockout-2.3.0quot, quotknockout.validationquot: quot../Scripts/knockout.validation.debugquot, 'Q': '../Scripts/q.min', quottoastrquot: quot../Scripts/toastrquot, 'text': '../Scripts/text', 'durandal': '../Scripts/durandal', 'plugins': '../Scripts/durandal/plugins', 'transitions': '../Scripts/durandal/transitions' }, shim: { quotknockout.validationquot: { deps: ['knockout'] }, quotjquery.uiquot: { deps: ['jquery'] } } }); require([quotjqueryquot, quotknockoutquot, quotQquot, quottoastrquot, quotjquery.uiquot, quotknockout.validationquot], function(jquery, ko, q, toastr) { window.jQuery = jquery; window.ko = ko; window.Q = q; window.toastr = toastr; }); require([quotconfig/tests/fakeAppConfigForTestquot], function () { }); The file quotfakeAppConfigForTest.jsquot contains some settings which are taken from web.config file from the project under test. With this second approach, the unit tests sometimes run successfully, sometimes fail with the errors: quotError: ReferenceError: Can't find variable: ko in file:///.../Scripts/knockout.validation.debug.js (line 30)quot quotResult Message: Error: accordion() method does not exist in file:///.../MICROSOFT/VISUALSTUDIO/12.0/EXTENSIONS/.../jasmine/v2/jasmine.js (line 565)quot quotResult Message: TypeError: 'undefined' is not an object (evaluating 'ko.validation.group') in file:///c:/programming/javascriptquot I think these errors appear because of the asynchronous loading of the dependencies with the require call require([quotdepencencyNamequot], function(){}). The same errors appear occasionally with the Code coverage. With this second approach, the error quotquotError: Error: Mismatched anonymous define() module:quot does not appear anymore. This second approach can be seen in the files: quotchutzpah.jsonquot and quotconfigurationForTestquot. I attached a project to reproduce the issues I encountered. Could you please tell me how can I load the global variables for the dependent libraries so that the unit tests and code coverage always run successfully? Thank you for your support.

title: Support for Angular (aka pure) HTML template imports
body:
tcima7[CodePlex]
We are using Chutzpah with QUnit to unit test our client side code which is built on the AngularJS framework. We have defined several AngularJS directives that reference templates located in external HTML files. These HTML files contain standard HTML snippets and are not wrapped with a ltscript type=quottext/htmlquotgt tag. It would be great if Chutzpah could extend it's existing template support to support pure HTML templates like those used by AngularJS. We would envision the implementation being a variation of the html2Js plugin used by the Karma test runner. The syntax to include templates could mirror that used by the existing template support in Chutzpah. See: html2js for Karma Related work item: #144 Let me know if you have any questions about our request. Thank you!

title: RequireJS racing conditions in coverage (blanket.js) fail to load tests
body:
DotNetWise[CodePlex]
When your project is 100% based on requireJS modules, there is a racing condition and mostly of the time the code coverage library (blanket.js) doesn't wait enough for all the requirejs dependinces to be loaded. We have sorted this out by https://github.com/alex-seville/blanket/issues/156#issuecomment-48900801 Please apply a similar fix to chutzpah's blanket_qunit.js file and requireJS samples. Thank you.

title: Chutzpah should not cause database connections to get open.
body:
MiguelIbarra[CodePlex]
Matthew, Frist and foremost, thank you for writing Chutzpah, it's been useful for me at my organization. We have configured Chutzpah in one of your projects. The test cases are discovered and run just fine. We're also able to run code coverage on the project. However, we are getting quotObject reference not set to an instance of an objectquot dialog errors from Visual Studio when opening our solution (see attached screenshot). I tracked down the problem to Chutzpah. I'm attaching a minimal case that reproduces the problem. Basically, if you have an Entity Framework connection string in the web.config file of a solution, Chutzpah will trigger a database connection when collecting the project's items. I debugged over chutzpah code and found the source of the error, this is the interesting part of the call trace: ... System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection.Open ... Microsoft.VisualStudio.Data.Package.DataConnection.EnsureConnected Microsoft.VisualStudio.Data.Package.DataExplorerNode.EnumerateOrRefreshChildren ... Microsoft.VisualStudio.Data.Package.DataExplorerConnection.TryGetProperty Microsoft.VisualStudio.Data.Package.DataExplorerConnection.Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsHierarchy.GetProperty VS11.Plugin.VsSolutionHelper.GetPropertyValue Line 84 ltltltltltltltltltltlt VS11.Plugin.VsSolutionHelper.GetProjectItems Line 48 ... Chutzpah.VS2012.TestAdapter.ChutzpahTestContainerDiscoverer.FindPotentialTestFiles Line 376 Chutzpah.VS2012.TestAdapter.ChutzpahTestContainerDiscoverer.OnSolutionProjectChanged It looks like the call to IVsHierarchy.GetProperty can cause database connections to get open when the project is using the Entity Framework. If you try to open the minimal case you won't get the quotObject reference not set to an instance of an object.quot errors, as I have cleaned the connection strings in the web.config file. But you should be seeing a quotConnect to SQL Serverquot dialog instead. Also, if you debug Chutzpah and break on System.Data.SqlClient.SqlException, you should be getting one on the GetPropertyValue method of the VsSolutionHelper class in Chutzpah. Also, please note that the minimal case solution can be opened without errors when you disable the Chutzpah Test Adapter plugin. We have found a work around, removing or commenting out Entity Framework's connection string in the web.config file avoids the errors to be thrown. So, fixing this is not urgent to us. However, it would be nice if Chutzpah stops triggering database connections. Miguel

title: Chutzpah is looking for tests across Database Connections
body:
TomKemper[CodePlex]
Our small team currently has a weird issue with Chutzpah. Sometimes, when opening a particular solution, we will repeatedly get quotCannot Connect To Sql Serverquot error dialogs, followed by a number of quotObject Reference Not Setquot error dialogs. Other solution files work fine. This of course looks very much like some weird problem in our .sln file, and that's probably the root cause. However, when I attached a second instance as a debugger, I noticed the error occuring with a call-stack originating in Chutzpah: It seems that the Chutzpah test-discoverer is a bit too liberal in searching for test-files. So while we'll probably be able to fix our immediate problem somewhere in our .sln or .suo file, there's still quite a decent performance gain to be had in Chutzpah. I'm guessing this is not really intended behavior. We first noticed this error in 3.2.1, and I've just updated to 3.2.2, which doesnt seem to fix it. The full call-stack at the time of the error is attached

title: Intellisense is ignoring references when a "-" is pressent in the chutzpah-excluded attribute
body:
mbordogna[CodePlex]
So I have what you would think is not a special environment case but maybe it is... I have a Mvc Web project, that I want to unit test the javascript files, however I do not what my tests in this project. So I decided to create another mvc project use it as the test project. I have been able to setup chutzpah to work in the ide using the json settions file to get to the referneces and event code coverage to work with blanket.js. (file references) so that headless testing will work with phantomjs.exe. Well Now that that is working, the fun begins. No developer in their right mind wants to work without intellisense..., Right? So after some investigation, I can add back the ///ltreferencegt tags to the test files. this seems to work, but then building becomes an issue for chutzpah is some of these will be HTTP references and can cause blanket.js to have cross-domain conflicts and fail.. So to correct that we add the chutzpah-excluded, attribute to the reference tag. Now the code coverage is fixed again.....But intellissense is broke again. So, I decided to play with the extra attribute a bit, thinking that the word excluded itself had something to do with it, and after changing the attr name from chutzpah-exclude to just chutzpah, it worked, intellisense was restored. I continued to play with it a bit and isolated it down to the fact that it is the quot-quot hyphen that is the actual issue. Intelisense is completely ignoring the reference tag if there is an attribute with a dash anywhere in it. granted this is a bug in intelisense but the easy solution is to chutzpah to support the attribute without the dash. Has anyone else seen this issue? Env: windows server 2012 R2 Visual Studio 2013 Update 2, with web essentials pack JSlint.net and chutzpah edge

title: TypeScript tests not showing in solution explorer when using external compile
body:
JustinCredible[CodePlex]
I tried using the example located @ /Samples/Compilation/ExternalCompile, but the TypeScript there had problems compiling when pasted into a new TypeScript solution. Perhaps they are for an older version of TypeScript? I tried to setup a sample project using similar settings as the example, but so far have been unsuccessful in getting the solution explorer to show tests for TypeScript files whose JS files are NOT included in the solution. (We don't want to include the JS/MAP files generated from TypeScript files in the solution because they are removed on clean). I have attached a sample solution which has two test files SimpleJsModuleTests.js and SimpleTsModuleTests.ts. These two test files test the SimpleJsModule.js and SimpleTsModule.ts modules respectively. I have verified that both test files run successfully from both of the right-click context menu options (Run JS Tests and Open in browser). Upon opening the solution you'll see that the test explorer only shows the four tests from the SimpleJsModuleTests.js file, while the other 4 tests from SimpleTsModuleTests.ts are not present. If I show all files in the solution explorer and right-click the generated SimpleTsModuleTests.js file and include it in the solution, the 4 additional tests will immediately show up in the solution explorer. From the documentation it appears that using the Compile Mode External should allow me to have the tests from a TS file show up in the Test Explorer without including the generated JS file in the solution. Is this a correct assumption?

title: Incorrect total of unit-tests
body:

We had some trouble with running the unit-tests in our Test explorer and our CI server. The test count was each time different. After searching we found out that not all Javascript tests were found or did not run at all. We have an idea how it can be possible some tests cant be found. When running the tests with PhantomJS the result will be the testname together with a random key based on the expectations. It could be possible that testnames are duplicate and not shown (and counted / run) anymore. We changed the output of the test result to unique names, after that we have no problems anymore with an incorrect count. Can this be fixed in Chutzpah too?
